title.zh: 《田敬仲完世家》 House of Tian Jingzhong
title.raw: 《田敬仲完世家》 House of Tian Jingzhong

sentences.zh: 陳完者，陳厲公他之子也。

translations.literal: Chen Wan ones, Chen Li gong Ta zhi zi.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Wan was a son of Duke Li of Chen, whose name was Ta.

sentences.zh: 完生，周太史過陳，陳厲公使卜完，卦得觀之否：「是為觀國之光，利用賓于王。

translations.literal: Wan sheng, Zhou tai shi guo Chen, Chen Li gong make bu Wan, gua de Guan zhi Pi: 'This become Guan country zhi light, li yong bin yu wang.'
translations.idiomatic: When Wan was born, Zhou's Grand Historian passed through Chen, and Duke Li of Chen had him divine Wan's fortune; the hexagram was Guan with Pi: 'This is the light that illuminates the kingdom, beneficial to be a guest of the king.

sentences.zh: 此其代陳有國乎？

translations.literal: This its dai Chen have country?
translations.idiomatic: Will this be his replacement of Chen possessing the state?

sentences.zh: 不在此而在異國乎？

translations.literal: Not in this yet in different country?
translations.idiomatic: Not in this land but in a foreign country?

sentences.zh: 非此其身也，在其子孫。

translations.literal: Not this its body, in its children grandchildren.
translations.idiomatic: Not in his own person, but in his descendants.

sentences.zh: 若在異國，必姜姓。

translations.literal: If in different country, must Jiang surname.
translations.idiomatic: If in a foreign country, it must be the Jiang surname.

sentences.zh: 姜姓，四嶽之後。

translations.literal: Jiang surname, four Yue after.
translations.idiomatic: The Jiang surname are descendants of the Four Peaks.

sentences.zh: 物莫能兩大，陳衰，此其昌乎？」

translations.literal: Thing mo able two big, Chen decline, this its flourish?'
translations.idiomatic: No thing can be great in two places; Chen declines, will this flourish?'

translations.literal: Chen Wan was a son of Duke Li of Chen, whose name was Ta. When Wan was born, Zhou's Grand Historian passed through Chen, and Duke Li of Chen had him divine Wan's fortune; the hexagram was Guan with Pi: 'This is the light that illuminates the kingdom, beneficial to be a guest of the king. Will this be his replacement of Chen possessing the state? Not in this land but in a foreign country? Not in his own person, but in his descendants. If in a foreign country, it must be the Jiang surname. The Jiang surname are descendants of the Four Peaks. No thing can be great in two places; Chen declines, will this flourish?'

sentences.zh: 厲公者，陳文公少子也，其母蔡女。

translations.literal: Li gong ones, Chen Wen gong little zi, its mother Cai female.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li was the youngest son of Duke Wen of Chen, his mother a woman of Cai.

sentences.zh: 文公卒，厲公兄鮑立，是為桓公。

translations.literal: Wen gong die, Li gong brother Bao stand, is become Huan gong.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen died, Duke Li's brother Bao ascended, becoming Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公與他異母。

translations.literal: Huan gong with Ta different mother.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan and Ta had different mothers.

sentences.zh: 及桓公病，蔡人為他殺桓公鮑及太子免而立他，為厲公。

translations.literal: Reach Huan gong disease, Cai person for Ta kill Huan gong Bao and crown prince Mian yet stand Ta, become Li gong.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Huan fell ill, Cai people killed Duke Huan Bao and Crown Prince Mian on Ta's behalf and established Ta, making him Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 厲公既立，娶蔡女。

translations.literal: Li gong ji stand, marry Cai female.
translations.idiomatic: Once Duke Li was established, he married a Cai woman.

sentences.zh: 蔡女淫於蔡人，數歸，厲公亦數如蔡。

translations.literal: Cai female yin yu Cai person, number return, Li gong also number ru Cai.
translations.idiomatic: The Cai woman was licentious with Cai men, frequently returning home, and Duke Li also frequently went to Cai.

sentences.zh: 桓公之少子林怨厲公殺其父與兄，乃令蔡人誘厲公而殺之。

translations.literal: Huan gong zhi little zi Lin resent Li gong kill its father with brother, then make Cai person seduce Li gong yet kill it.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan's youngest son Lin resented Duke Li for killing his father and brother, so he had Cai people lure Duke Li and kill him.

sentences.zh: 林自立，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Lin self stand, is become Zhuang gong.
translations.idiomatic: Lin established himself, becoming Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 故陳完不得立，為陳大夫。

translations.literal: Therefore Chen Wan not obtain stand, become Chen da fu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Chen Wan could not establish himself and became a grandee of Chen.

sentences.zh: 厲公之殺，以淫出國，故《春秋》曰「蔡人殺陳他」，罪之也。

translations.literal: Li gong zhi kill, with yin out country, therefore 'Spring Autumn' said 'Cai person kill Chen Ta', crime it.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li's killing resulted from licentiousness abroad, therefore the Spring and Autumn Annals says 'Cai people killed Chen Ta' to condemn it.

translations.literal: Duke Li was the youngest son of Duke Wen of Chen, his mother a woman of Cai. When Duke Wen died, Duke Li's brother Bao ascended, becoming Duke Huan. Duke Huan and Ta had different mothers. When Duke Huan fell ill, Cai people killed Duke Huan Bao and Crown Prince Mian on Ta's behalf and established Ta, making him Duke Li. Once Duke Li was established, he married a Cai woman. The Cai woman was licentious with Cai men, frequently returning home, and Duke Li also frequently went to Cai. Duke Huan's youngest son Lin resented Duke Li for killing his father and brother, so he had Cai people lure Duke Li and kill him. Lin established himself, becoming Duke Zhuang. Therefore Chen Wan could not establish himself and became a grandee of Chen. Duke Li's killing resulted from licentiousness abroad, therefore the Spring and Autumn Annals says 'Cai people killed Chen Ta' to condemn it.

sentences.zh: 莊公卒，立弟杵臼，是為宣公。

translations.literal: Zhuang gong die, stand di Chu Jiu, is become Xuan gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang died and his younger brother Chu Jiu ascended, becoming Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公［二］十一年，殺其太子御寇。

translations.literal: Xuan gong [two] ten one year, kill its crown prince Yu Kou.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year of Duke Xuan, he killed his crown prince Yu Kou.

sentences.zh: 御寇與完相愛，恐禍及己，完故奔齊。

translations.literal: Yu Kou with Wan mutually loved, feared disaster reach self, Wan thus fled Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公欲使為卿，辭曰：「羈旅之臣幸得免負檐，君之惠也，不敢當高位。」

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong wished make him minister, declined said: 'Sojourning minister fortunate get avoid burden eave, lord favor, not dare receive high position.'

sentences.zh: 桓公使為工正。

translations.literal: Huan Gong made him work overseer.

sentences.zh: 齊懿仲欲妻完，卜之，占曰：「是謂鳳皇于蜚，和鳴鏘鏘。

translations.literal: Qi Yi Zhong wished marry Wan, divined it, omen said: 'This called phoenix fly, harmonious cry clang clang.

sentences.zh: 有媯之後，將育于姜。

translations.literal: Have Gui after, will nurture at Jiang.

sentences.zh: 五世其昌，并于正卿。

translations.literal: Five generations its prosper, equal to proper ministers.

sentences.zh: 八世之後，莫之與京。」

translations.literal: Eight generations after, none rival capital.'

sentences.zh: 卒妻完。

translations.literal: Finally married Wan.

sentences.zh: 完之奔齊，齊桓公立十四年矣。

translations.literal: Wan fled Qi, Qi Huan Gong established fourteen years.

Duke Zhuang died and his younger brother Chu Jiu ascended, becoming Duke Xuan. In the twenty-first year of Duke Xuan, he killed his crown prince Yu Kou. Yu Kou with Wan mutually loved, feared disaster reach self, Wan thus fled Qi. Qi Huan Gong wished make him minister, declined said: 'Sojourning minister fortunate get avoid burden eave, lord favor, not dare receive high position.' Huan Gong made him work overseer. Qi Yi Zhong wished marry Wan, divined it, omen said: 'This called phoenix fly, harmonious cry clang clang. Have Gui after, will nurture at Jiang. Five generations its prosper, equal to proper ministers. Eight generations after, none rival capital.' Finally married Wan. Wan fled Qi, Qi Huan Gong established fourteen years.

sentences.zh: 完卒，謚為敬仲。

translations.literal: Wan died, posthumous name Jing Zhong.

sentences.zh: 仲生稚孟夷。

translations.literal: Zhong gave birth Zhi Meng Yi.

sentences.zh: 敬仲之如齊，以陳字為田氏。

translations.literal: Jing Zhong enter Qi, with Chen character became Tian clan.
Wan died, posthumous name Jing Zhong. Zhong gave birth Zhi Meng Yi. Jing Zhong enter Qi, with Chen character became Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 田稚孟夷生湣孟莊，田湣孟莊生文子須無。

translations.literal: Tian Zhi Meng Yi gave birth Min Meng Zhuang, Tian Min Meng Zhuang gave birth Wen Zi Xu Wu.

sentences.zh: 田文子事齊莊公。

translations.literal: Tian Wen Zi served Qi Zhuang Gong.
Tian Zhi Meng Yi gave birth Min Meng Zhuang, Tian Min Meng Zhuang gave birth Wen Zi Xu Wu. Tian Wen Zi served Qi Zhuang Gong.

sentences.zh: 晉之大夫欒逞作亂於晉，來奔齊，齊莊公厚客之。

translations.literal: Jin grand master Luan Ying made chaos at Jin, came fled Qi, Qi Zhuang Gong thick guest him.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰與田文子諫，莊公弗聽。

translations.literal: Yan Ying with Tian Wen Zi advised, Zhuang Gong not listened.
Jin grand master Luan Ying made chaos at Jin, came fled Qi, Qi Zhuang Gong thick guest him. Yan Ying with Tian Wen Zi advised, Zhuang Gong not listened.

sentences.zh: 文子卒，生桓子無宇。

translations.literal: Wen Zi died, gave birth Huan Zi Wu Yu.

sentences.zh: 田桓子無宇有力，事齊莊公，甚有寵。

translations.literal: Tian Huan Zi Wu Yu had strength, served Qi Zhuang Gong, very favored.
Wen Zi died, gave birth Huan Zi Wu Yu. Tian Huan Zi Wu Yu had strength, served Qi Zhuang Gong, very favored.

sentences.zh: 無宇卒，生武子開與釐子乞。

translations.literal: Wu Yu died, gave birth Wu Zi Kai with Xi Zi Qi.

sentences.zh: 田釐子乞事齊景公為大夫，其收賦稅於民以小斗受之，其（粟）［稟］予民以大斗，行陰德於民，而景公弗禁。

translations.literal: Tian Xi Zi Qi served Qi Jing Gong as grand master, his collected taxes from people with small dou received, his granted people with big dou, practiced hidden virtue on people, yet Jing Gong not forbade.

sentences.zh: 由此田氏得齊眾心，宗族益彊，民思田氏。

translations.literal: By this Tian shi obtain Qi zhong xin, zong zu yi qiang, people think Tian shi.
translations.idiomatic: From this the Tian clan won the hearts of the Qi multitudes, their clansmen grew stronger, and the people thought of the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 晏子數諫景公，景公弗聽。

translations.literal: Yan zi number jian Jing gong, Jing gong not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Master Yan repeatedly admonished Duke Jing, but Duke Jing would not listen.

sentences.zh: 已而使於晉，與叔向私語曰：「齊國之政卒歸於田氏矣。」

translations.literal: Already yet shi yu Jin, with Shu Xiang private language said: 'Qi country zhi zheng zu gui yu Tian shi.'
translations.idiomatic: Later when he was sent to Jin, he privately spoke with Shu Xiang: 'The governance of Qi will ultimately return to the Tian clan.'

translations.literal: Wu Yu died, gave birth Wu Zi Kai with Xi Zi Qi. Tian Xi Zi Qi served Qi Jing Gong as grand master, his collected taxes from people with small dou received, his granted people with big dou, practiced hidden virtue on people, yet Jing Gong not forbade. From this the Tian clan won the hearts of the Qi multitudes, their clansmen grew stronger, and the people thought of the Tian clan. Master Yan repeatedly admonished Duke Jing, but Duke Jing would not listen. Later when he was sent to Jin, he privately spoke with Shu Xiang: 'The governance of Qi will ultimately return to the Tian clan.'

sentences.zh: 晏嬰卒後，范、中行氏反晉。

translations.literal: Yan Ying die after, Fan, Zhong Xing shi rebel Jin.
translations.idiomatic: After Yan Ying died, the Fan and Zhong Xing clans rebelled against Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉攻之急，范、中行請粟於齊。

translations.literal: Jin attack it ji, Fan, Zhong Xing request su yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked them urgently, and the Fan and Zhong Xing clans requested grain from Qi.

sentences.zh: 田乞欲為亂，樹黨於諸侯，乃說景公曰：「范、中行數有德於齊，齊不可不救。」

translations.literal: Tian Qi desire become chaos, shu dang yu various hou, then shuo Jing gong said: 'Fan, Zhong Xing number have virtue yu Qi, Qi not able not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi desired to create disorder and establish partisans among the feudal lords, so he persuaded Duke Jing: 'The Fan and Zhong Xing clans have repeatedly shown virtue toward Qi, Qi cannot fail to save them.'

sentences.zh: 齊使田乞救之而輸之粟。

translations.literal: Qi make Tian Qi save it yet transport it su.
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent Tian Qi to save them and transport grain to them.

translations.literal: After Yan Ying died, the Fan and Zhong Xing clans rebelled against Jin. Jin attacked them urgently, and the Fan and Zhong Xing clans requested grain from Qi. Tian Qi desired to create disorder and establish partisans among the feudal lords, so he persuaded Duke Jing: 'The Fan and Zhong Xing clans have repeatedly shown virtue toward Qi, Qi cannot fail to save them.' Qi sent Tian Qi to save them and transport grain to them.

sentences.zh: 景公太子死，後有寵姬曰芮子，生子荼。

translations.literal: Jing gong crown prince die, after have pet ji said Rui zi, sheng zi Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's crown prince died, and later he had a favored concubine called Rui Zi who bore a son Tu.

sentences.zh: 景公病，命其相國惠子與高昭子以子荼為太子。

translations.literal: Jing gong disease, ming its xiang Guo Hui zi with Gao Zhao zi with zi Tu become crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing fell ill and commanded his chancellor Guo Hui Zi and Gao Zhao Zi to make Zi Tu crown prince.

sentences.zh: 景公卒，兩相高、國立荼，是為晏孺子。

translations.literal: Jing gong die, two xiang Gao, Guo stand Tu, is become Yan Ru zi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died, and the two chancellors Gao and Guo established Tu, who became Yan Ruzi.

sentences.zh: 而田乞不說，欲立景公他子陽生。

translations.literal: Yet Tian Qi not shuo, desire stand Jing gong other zi Yang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: But Tian Qi was displeased and desired to establish Duke Jing's other son Yang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 陽生素與乞歡。

translations.literal: Yang Sheng su with Qi huan.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Sheng had long been on good terms with Qi.

sentences.zh: 晏孺子之立也，陽生奔魯。

translations.literal: Yan Ru zi zhi stand, Yang Sheng ben Lu.
translations.idiomatic: When Yan Ruzi was established, Yang Sheng fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 田乞偽事高昭子、國惠子者，每朝代參乘，言曰：「始諸大夫不欲立孺子。

translations.literal: Tian Qi wei shi Gao Zhao zi, Guo Hui zi ones, every court dai can sheng, yan said: 'Shi various da fu not desire stand ru zi.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi falsely served Gao Zhao Zi and Guo Hui Zi, and at every court session took turns as their chariot companion, saying: 'At first the various grandees did not want to establish Ruzi.

sentences.zh: 孺子既立，君相之，大夫皆自危，謀作亂。」

translations.literal: Ru zi ji stand, jun xiang it, da fu all self wei, plan make chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: Now that Ruzi is established, you two chancellors support him, and all the grandees feel endangered and are plotting rebellion.'

sentences.zh: 又紿大夫曰：「高昭子可畏也，及未發先之。」

translations.literal: Again dai da fu said: 'Gao Zhao zi can wei, reach not send first it.'
translations.idiomatic: He also deceived the grandees: 'Gao Zhao Zi is fearsome; while he has not yet acted, strike first.'

sentences.zh: 諸大夫從之。

translations.literal: Various da fu follow it.
translations.idiomatic: The various grandees followed this.

sentences.zh: 田乞、鮑牧與大夫以兵入公室，攻高昭子。

translations.literal: Tian Qi, Bao Mu with da fu with troops enter gong shi, attack Gao Zhao zi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi and Bao Mu entered the ducal palace with the grandees and troops, attacking Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 昭子聞之，與國惠子救公。

translations.literal: Zhao zi hear it, with Guo Hui zi save gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Zi heard of it and with Guo Hui Zi went to save the duke.

sentences.zh: 公師敗。

translations.literal: Gong shi defeat.
translations.idiomatic: The duke's forces were defeated.

sentences.zh: 田乞之眾追國惠子，惠子奔莒，遂返殺高昭子。

translations.literal: Tian Qi zhi zhong zhui Guo Hui zi, Hui zi ben Ju, sui return kill Gao Zhao zi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi's multitude pursued Guo Hui Zi; Hui Zi fled to Ju, then they returned and killed Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 晏（孺子）［圉］奔魯。

translations.literal: Yan (ru zi) [yu] ben Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Yu fled to Lu.

translations.literal: Duke Jing's crown prince died, and later he had a favored concubine called Rui Zi who bore a son Tu. Duke Jing fell ill and commanded his chancellor Guo Hui Zi and Gao Zhao Zi to make Zi Tu crown prince. Duke Jing died, and the two chancellors Gao and Guo established Tu, who became Yan Ruzi. But Tian Qi was displeased and desired to establish Duke Jing's other son Yang Sheng. Yang Sheng had long been on good terms with Qi. When Yan Ruzi was established, Yang Sheng fled to Lu. Tian Qi falsely served Gao Zhao Zi and Guo Hui Zi, and at every court session took turns as their chariot companion, saying: 'At first the various grandees did not want to establish Ruzi. Now that Ruzi is established, you two chancellors support him, and all the grandees feel endangered and are plotting rebellion.' He also deceived the grandees: 'Gao Zhao Zi is fearsome; while he has not yet acted, strike first.' The various grandees followed this. Tian Qi and Bao Mu entered the ducal palace with the grandees and troops, attacking Gao Zhao Zi. Zhao Zi heard of it and with Guo Hui Zi went to save the duke. The duke's forces were defeated. Tian Qi's multitude pursued Guo Hui Zi; Hui Zi fled to Ju, then they returned and killed Gao Zhao Zi. Yan Yu fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 田乞使人之魯，迎陽生。

translations.literal: Tian Qi make person zhi Lu, welcome Yang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi sent people to Lu to welcome Yang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 陽生至齊，匿田乞家。

translations.literal: Yang Sheng arrive Qi, ni Tian Qi home.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Sheng arrived in Qi and hid in Tian Qi's home.

sentences.zh: 請諸大夫曰：「常之母有魚菽之祭，幸而來會飲。」

translations.literal: Request various da fu said: 'Often zhi mother have fish shu zhi ji, fortunate yet come hui drink.'
translations.idiomatic: He invited the various grandees: 'My mother's regular fish and bean sacrifice is happening; do me the honor of coming to drink together.'

sentences.zh: 會飲田氏。

translations.literal: Hui drink Tian shi.
translations.idiomatic: They gathered to drink at the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 田乞盛陽生橐中，置坐中央。

translations.literal: Tian Qi sheng Yang Sheng tuo zhong, zhi zuo zhong yang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi hid Yang Sheng in a bag and placed it in the center of the seats.

sentences.zh: 發橐，出陽生，曰：「此乃齊君矣。」

translations.literal: Send tuo, out Yang Sheng, said: 'This then Qi jun.'
translations.idiomatic: He opened the bag and brought out Yang Sheng, saying: 'This is the lord of Qi.'

sentences.zh: 大夫皆伏謁。

translations.literal: Da fu all fu ye.
translations.idiomatic: All the grandees prostrated themselves in audience.

sentences.zh: 將盟立之，田乞誣曰：「吾與鮑牧謀共立陽生也。」

translations.literal: Will meng stand it, Tian Qi wu said: 'I with Bao Mu plan together stand Yang Sheng.'
translations.idiomatic: When they were about to covenant and establish him, Tian Qi falsely said: 'Bao Mu and I plotted together to establish Yang Sheng.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧怒曰：「大夫忘景公之命乎？」

translations.literal: Bao Mu nu said: 'Da fu forget Jing gong zhi ming?'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu angrily said: 'Have the grandees forgotten Duke Jing's command?'

sentences.zh: 諸大夫欲悔，陽生乃頓首曰：「可則立之，不可則已。」

translations.literal: Various da fu desire regret, Yang Sheng then dun shou said: 'Able then stand it, not able then stop.'
translations.idiomatic: The various grandees wanted to back out, but Yang Sheng kowtowed and said: 'If possible, establish me; if not, let it be.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧恐禍及己，乃復曰：「皆景公之子，何為不可！」

translations.literal: Bao Mu kong huo reach self, then reply said: 'All Jing gong zhi zi, what for not able!'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu feared calamity would reach him, so he replied: 'All are sons of Duke Jing, why should it not be possible!'

sentences.zh: 遂立陽生於田乞之家，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Sui stand Yang Sheng yu Tian Qi zhi home, is become Dao gong.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yang Sheng was established in Tian Qi's home, becoming Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 乃使人遷晏孺子於駘，而殺孺子荼。

translations.literal: Then make person move Yan ru zi yu Tai, yet kill ru zi Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Then people were sent to move Yan Ruzi to Tai, and Ruzi Tu was killed.

sentences.zh: 悼公既立，田乞為相，專齊政。

translations.literal: Dao gong ji stand, Tian Qi become xiang, zhuan Qi zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Once Duke Dao was established, Tian Qi became chancellor and monopolized Qi's governance.

translations.literal: Tian Qi sent people to Lu to welcome Yang Sheng. Yang Sheng arrived in Qi and hid in Tian Qi's home. He invited the various grandees: 'My mother's regular fish and bean sacrifice is happening; do me the honor of coming to drink together.' They gathered to drink at the Tian clan. Tian Qi hid Yang Sheng in a bag and placed it in the center of the seats. He opened the bag and brought out Yang Sheng, saying: 'This is the lord of Qi.' All the grandees prostrated themselves in audience. When they were about to covenant and establish him, Tian Qi falsely said: 'Bao Mu and I plotted together to establish Yang Sheng.' Bao Mu angrily said: 'Have the grandees forgotten Duke Jing's command?' The various grandees wanted to back out, but Yang Sheng kowtowed and said: 'If possible, establish me; if not, let it be.' Bao Mu feared calamity would reach him, so he replied: 'All are sons of Duke Jing, why should it not be possible!' Thus Yang Sheng was established in Tian Qi's home, becoming Duke Dao. Then people were sent to move Yan Ruzi to Tai, and Ruzi Tu was killed. Once Duke Dao was established, Tian Qi became chancellor and monopolized Qi's governance.

sentences.zh: 四年，田乞卒，子常代立，是為田成子。

translations.literal: Four years, Tian Qi die, zi Chang dai stand, is become Tian Cheng zi.
translations.idiomatic: After four years, Tian Qi died, and his son Chang took his place, becoming Tian Cheng Zi.

translations.literal: After four years, Tian Qi died, and his son Chang took his place, becoming Tian Cheng Zi.

sentences.zh: 鮑牧與齊悼公有郄，弒悼公。

translations.literal: Bao Mu with Qi Dao gong have xi, shi Dao gong.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu had a grudge against Duke Dao of Qi and assassinated Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 齊人共立其子壬，是為簡公。

translations.literal: Qi person together stand its zi Ren, is become Jian gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people together established his son Ren, who became Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 田常成子與監止俱為左右相，相簡公。

translations.literal: Tian Chang Cheng zi with Jian Zhi all become left right xiang, xiang Jian gong.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang Cheng Zi and Jian Zhi both became left and right chancellors, assisting Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 田常心害監止，監止幸於簡公，權弗能去。

translations.literal: Tian Chang xin hai Jian Zhi, Jian Zhi xing yu Jian gong, quan not able go.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang harbored hatred for Jian Zhi in his heart, but Jian Zhi was favored by Duke Jian, so Tian Chang could not remove his power.

sentences.zh: 於是田常復修釐子之政，以大斗出貸，以小斗收。

translations.literal: Then Tian Chang again repair Xi zi zhi zheng, with big dou out dai, with small dou receive.
translations.idiomatic: Then Tian Chang revived Xi Zi's policies, lending with large measures and collecting with small measures.

sentences.zh: 齊人歌之曰：「嫗乎采芑，歸乎田成子！」

translations.literal: Qi person song it said: 'Yu, pick Qi, return Tian Cheng zi!'
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people sang of it: 'Old woman, gathering qi, return to Tian Cheng Zi!'

sentences.zh: 齊大夫朝，御鞅諫簡公曰：「田、監不可并也，君其擇焉。」

translations.literal: Qi da fu court, Yu Yang jian Jian gong said: 'Tian, Jian not able bing, jun its choose.'
translations.idiomatic: When the Qi grandees attended court, Yu Yang admonished Duke Jian: 'Tian and Jian cannot coexist; Your Lordship should choose between them.'

sentences.zh: 君弗聽。

translations.literal: Jun not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The lord would not listen.

translations.literal: Bao Mu had a grudge against Duke Dao of Qi and assassinated Duke Dao. The Qi people together established his son Ren, who became Duke Jian. Tian Chang Cheng Zi and Jian Zhi both became left and right chancellors, assisting Duke Jian. Tian Chang harbored hatred for Jian Zhi in his heart, but Jian Zhi was favored by Duke Jian, so Tian Chang could not remove his power. Then Tian Chang revived Xi Zi's policies, lending with large measures and collecting with small measures. The Qi people sang of it: 'Old woman, gathering qi, return to Tian Cheng Zi!' When the Qi grandees attended court, Yu Yang admonished Duke Jian: 'Tian and Jian cannot coexist; Your Lordship should choose between them.' The lord would not listen.

sentences.zh: 子我者，監止之宗人也，常與田氏有卻。

translations.literal: Zi Wo ones, Jian Zhi zhi zong person, constant with Tian shi have que.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo was a clansman of Jian Zhi and constantly had grievances with the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 田氏疏族田豹事子我有寵。

translations.literal: Tian shi shu zu Tian Bao shi Zi Wo have pet.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Bao, a distant clansman of the Tian clan, served Zi Wo and was favored.

sentences.zh: 子我曰：「吾欲盡滅田氏適，以豹代田氏宗。」

translations.literal: Zi Wo said: 'I desire all extinguish Tian shi di, with Bao dai Tian shi zong.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo said: 'I want to exterminate all the Tian clan's legitimate heirs and replace the Tian clan leadership with Bao.'

sentences.zh: 豹曰：「臣於田氏疏矣。」

translations.literal: Bao said: 'Minister yu Tian shi shu.'
translations.idiomatic: Bao said: 'I am distant from the Tian clan.'

sentences.zh: 不聽。

translations.literal: Not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He would not listen.

sentences.zh: 已而豹謂田氏曰：「子我將誅田氏，田氏弗先，禍及矣。」

translations.literal: Already yet Bao wei Tian shi said: 'Zi Wo will zhu Tian shi, Tian shi not first, huo reach.'
translations.idiomatic: Later Bao told the Tian clan: 'Zi Wo is about to execute the Tian clan; if the Tian clan does not strike first, calamity will reach you.'

sentences.zh: 子我舍公宮，田常兄弟四人乘如公宮，欲殺子我。

translations.literal: Zi Wo sha gong gong, Tian Chang brothers four people sheng ru gong gong, desire kill Zi Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo lodged in the ducal palace, and Tian Chang's four brothers rode to the ducal palace, desiring to kill Zi Wo.

sentences.zh: 子我閉門。

translations.literal: Zi Wo bi men.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo closed the gates.

sentences.zh: 簡公與婦人飲檀臺，將欲擊田常。

translations.literal: Jian gong with woman drink Tan Tai, will desire strike Tian Chang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian was drinking with women on Tan Terrace and was about to attack Tian Chang.

sentences.zh: 太史子餘曰：「田常非敢為亂，將除害。」

translations.literal: Tai shi Zi Yu said: 'Tian Chang not dare become chaos, will remove hai.'
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian Zi Yu said: 'Tian Chang does not dare rebel; he is about to remove harm.'

sentences.zh: 簡公乃止。

translations.literal: Jian gong then stop.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian then stopped.

sentences.zh: 田常出，聞簡公怒，恐誅，將出亡。

translations.literal: Tian Chang out, hear Jian gong nu, kong zhu, will out perish.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang went out, heard that Duke Jian was angry, feared execution, and was about to flee.

sentences.zh: 田子行曰：「需，事之賊也。」

translations.literal: Tian Zi Xing said: 'Rui, shi zhi zei.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zi Xing said: 'Delay is the thief of affairs.'

sentences.zh: 田常於是擊子我。

translations.literal: Tian Chang then strike Zi Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang then attacked Zi Wo.

sentences.zh: 子我率其徒攻田氏，不勝，出亡。

translations.literal: Zi Wo lead its tu attack Tian shi, not win, out perish.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo led his followers to attack the Tian clan but did not prevail, so fled.

sentences.zh: 田氏之徒追殺子我及監止。

translations.literal: Tian shi zhi tu zhui kill Zi Wo and Jian Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian clan's followers pursued and killed Zi Wo and Jian Zhi.

translations.literal: Zi Wo was a clansman of Jian Zhi and constantly had grievances with the Tian clan. Tian Bao, a distant clansman of the Tian clan, served Zi Wo and was favored. Zi Wo said: 'I want to exterminate all the Tian clan's legitimate heirs and replace the Tian clan leadership with Bao.' Bao said: 'I am distant from the Tian clan.' He would not listen. Later Bao told the Tian clan: 'Zi Wo is about to execute the Tian clan; if the Tian clan does not strike first, calamity will reach you.' Zi Wo lodged in the ducal palace, and Tian Chang's four brothers rode to the ducal palace, desiring to kill Zi Wo. Zi Wo closed the gates. Duke Jian was drinking with women on Tan Terrace and was about to attack Tian Chang. Grand Historian Zi Yu said: 'Tian Chang does not dare rebel; he is about to remove harm.' Duke Jian then stopped. Tian Chang went out, heard that Duke Jian was angry, feared execution, and was about to flee. Tian Zi Xing said: 'Delay is the thief of affairs.' Tian Chang then attacked Zi Wo. Zi Wo led his followers to attack the Tian clan but did not prevail, so fled. The Tian clan's followers pursued and killed Zi Wo and Jian Zhi.

sentences.zh: 簡公出奔，田氏之徒追執簡公于徐州。

translations.literal: Jian gong out ben, Tian shi zhi tu zhui zhi Jian gong yu Xu zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian fled, and the Tian clan's followers pursued and captured Duke Jian at Xuzhou.

sentences.zh: 簡公曰：「蚤從御鞅之言，不及此難。」

translations.literal: Jian gong said: 'Early follow Yu Yang zhi yan, not reach this nan.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian said: 'If only I had followed Yu Yang's words earlier, I would not have reached this difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 田氏之徒恐簡公復立而誅己，遂殺簡公。

translations.literal: Tian shi zhi tu kong Jian gong again stand yet zhu self, sui kill Jian gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian clan's followers feared Duke Jian would be reestablished and execute them, so they killed Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 簡公立四年而殺。

translations.literal: Jian gong stand four years yet kill.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian had been established four years when he was killed.

sentences.zh: 於是田常立簡公弟驁，是為平公。

translations.literal: Then Tian Chang stand Jian gong di Ao, is become Ping gong.
translations.idiomatic: Then Tian Chang established Duke Jian's younger brother Ao, who became Duke Ping.

sentences.zh: 平公即位，田常為相。

translations.literal: Ping gong ji wei, Tian Chang become xiang.
translations.idiomatic: Once Duke Ping ascended, Tian Chang became chancellor.

translations.literal: Duke Jian fled, and the Tian clan's followers pursued and captured Duke Jian at Xuzhou. Duke Jian said: 'If only I had followed Yu Yang's words earlier, I would not have reached this difficulty.' The Tian clan's followers feared Duke Jian would be reestablished and execute them, so they killed Duke Jian. Duke Jian had been established four years when he was killed. Then Tian Chang established Duke Jian's younger brother Ao, who became Duke Ping. Once Duke Ping ascended, Tian Chang became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 田常既殺簡公，懼諸侯共誅己，乃盡歸魯、衛侵地，西約晉、韓、魏、趙氏，南通吳、越之使，修功行賞，親於百姓，以故齊復定。

translations.literal: Tian Chang ji kill Jian gong, ju various hou together zhu self, then all return Lu, Wei invade land, west yue Jin, Han, Wei, Zhao shi, south tong Wu, Yue zhi shi, repair merit xing shang, qin yu bai xing, with reason Qi again ding.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang, having killed Duke Jian, feared the feudal lords would together execute him, so he returned all the invaded lands to Lu and Wei, made covenants to the west with the Jin, Han, Wei, and Zhao clans, opened communications to the south with Wu and Yue envoys, rewarded merit and performed favors, and was close to the common people, which is why Qi was again pacified.

translations.literal: Tian Chang, having killed Duke Jian, feared the feudal lords would together execute him, so he returned all the invaded lands to Lu and Wei, made covenants to the west with the Jin, Han, Wei, and Zhao clans, opened communications to the south with Wu and Yue envoys, rewarded merit and performed favors, and was close to the common people, which is why Qi was again pacified.

sentences.zh: 田常言於齊平公曰：「德施人之所欲，君其行之；

translations.literal: Tian Chang yan yu Qi Ping gong said: 'Virtue shi person zhi place desire, jun its do it;
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang spoke to Duke Ping of Qi: 'Bestow virtue on what people desire; Your Lordship should perform it;

sentences.zh: 刑罰人之所惡，臣請行之。」

translations.literal: Punishment fa person zhi place wu, minister request do it.'
translations.idiomatic: Administer punishments on what people hate; I request to perform it.'

sentences.zh: 行之五年，齊國之政皆歸田常。

translations.literal: Do it five years, Qi country zhi zheng all return Tian Chang.
translations.idiomatic: After five years of this, all Qi's governance returned to Tian Chang.

sentences.zh: 田常於是盡誅鮑、晏、監止及公族之彊者，而割齊自安平以東至瑯邪，自為封邑。

translations.literal: Tian Chang then all zhu Bao, Yan, Jian Zhi and gong zu zhi qiang ones, yet cut Qi self An Ping with east reach Lang Ya, self become feng yi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang then executed all the Bao, Yan, Jian Zhi clans and the strong ones of the ducal clan, and carved out Qi territory from Anping eastward to Langya as his own fief.

sentences.zh: 封邑大於平公之所食。

translations.literal: Feng yi big yu Ping gong zhi place shi.
translations.idiomatic: His fief was larger than what Duke Ping ate from.

translations.literal: Tian Chang spoke to Duke Ping of Qi: 'Bestow virtue on what people desire; Your Lordship should perform it; Administer punishments on what people hate; I request to perform it.' After five years of this, all Qi's governance returned to Tian Chang. Tian Chang then executed all the Bao, Yan, Jian Zhi clans and the strong ones of the ducal clan, and carved out Qi territory from Anping eastward to Langya as his own fief. His fief was larger than what Duke Ping ate from.

sentences.zh: 田常乃選齊國中女子長七尺以上為後宮，後宮以百數，而使賓客舍人出入後宮者不禁。

translations.literal: Tian Chang then select Qi country zhong female zi long seven chi above become hou gong, hou gong with hundred number, yet make bin ke she person out in hou gong ones not jin.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang then selected women from Qi who were seven chi tall or more for his harem, his harem numbering in the hundreds, and allowed guests and retainers to enter and leave the harem without restriction.

sentences.zh: 及田常卒，有七十餘男。

translations.literal: Reach Tian Chang die, have seventy yu male.
translations.idiomatic: When Tian Chang died, he had over seventy sons.

translations.literal: Tian Chang then selected women from Qi who were seven chi tall or more for his harem, his harem numbering in the hundreds, and allowed guests and retainers to enter and leave the harem without restriction. When Tian Chang died, he had over seventy sons.

sentences.zh: 田常卒，子襄子盤代立，相齊。

translations.literal: Tian Chang die, zi Xiang zi Pan dai stand, xiang Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang died, and his son Xiang Zi Pan took his place, assisting Qi.

sentences.zh: 常謚為成子。

translations.literal: Chang shi become Cheng zi.
translations.idiomatic: Chang was posthumously titled Cheng Zi.

translations.literal: Tian Chang died, and his son Xiang Zi Pan took his place, assisting Qi. Chang was posthumously titled Cheng Zi.

sentences.zh: 田襄子既相齊宣公，三晉殺知伯，分其地。

translations.literal: Tian Xiang zi ji xiang Qi Xuan gong, three Jin kill Zhi Bo, divide its land.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Xiang Zi, having assisted Duke Xuan of Qi, saw the three Jin kill Zhi Bo and divide his lands.

sentences.zh: 襄子使其兄弟宗人盡為齊都邑大夫，與三晉通使，且以有齊國。

translations.literal: Xiang zi make its brothers zong person all become Qi du yi da fu, with three Jin tong shi, and with have Qi country.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi had all his brothers and clansmen become grandees of Qi's cities and towns, opened communications with the three Jin, and thereby possessed Qi.

translations.literal: Tian Xiang Zi, having assisted Duke Xuan of Qi, saw the three Jin kill Zhi Bo and divide his lands. Xiang Zi had all his brothers and clansmen become grandees of Qi's cities and towns, opened communications with the three Jin, and thereby possessed Qi.

sentences.zh: 襄子卒，子莊子白立。

translations.literal: Xiang zi die, zi Zhuang zi Bai stand.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi died, and his son Zhuang Zi Bai established himself.

sentences.zh: 田莊子相齊宣公。

translations.literal: Tian Zhuang zi xiang Qi Xuan gong.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zhuang Zi assisted Duke Xuan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 宣公四十三年，伐晉，毀黃城，圍陽狐。

translations.literal: Xuan gong forty three years, attack Jin, destroy Huang cheng, surround Yang Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's forty-third year, he attacked Jin, destroyed Huang Castle, and besieged Yanghu.

sentences.zh: 明年，伐魯、葛及安陵。

translations.literal: Next year, attack Lu, Ge and An Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, he attacked Lu, Ge, and Anling.

sentences.zh: 明年，取魯之一城。

translations.literal: Next year, take Lu zhi one cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, he took one city from Lu.

translations.literal: Xiang Zi died, and his son Zhuang Zi Bai established himself. Tian Zhuang Zi assisted Duke Xuan of Qi. In Duke Xuan's forty-third year, he attacked Jin, destroyed Huang Castle, and besieged Yanghu. The next year, he attacked Lu, Ge, and Anling. The next year, he took one city from Lu.

sentences.zh: 莊子卒，子太公和立。

translations.literal: Zhuang zi die, zi Tai gong He stand.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Zi died, and his son Tai Gong He established himself.

sentences.zh: 田太公相齊宣公。

translations.literal: Tian Tai gong xiang Qi Xuan gong.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Tai Gong assisted Duke Xuan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 宣公四十八年，取魯之城。

translations.literal: Xuan gong forty eight years, take Lu zhi cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's forty-eighth year, he took cities from Lu.

sentences.zh: 明年，宣公與鄭人會西城。

translations.literal: Next year, Xuan gong with Zheng person hui Xi cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Duke Xuan met with Zheng people at Xicheng.

sentences.zh: 伐衛，取毋丘。

translations.literal: Attack Wei, take Wu Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Wei and took Wuqiu.

sentences.zh: 宣公五十一年卒，田會自廩丘反。

translations.literal: Xuan gong fifty one years die, Tian Hui self Lin Qiu return.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died in his fifty-first year, and Tian Hui rebelled from Linqiu.

translations.literal: Zhuang Zi died, and his son Tai Gong He established himself. Tian Tai Gong assisted Duke Xuan of Qi. In Duke Xuan's forty-eighth year, he took cities from Lu. The next year, Duke Xuan met with Zheng people at Xicheng. He attacked Wei and took Wuqiu. Duke Xuan died in his fifty-first year, and Tian Hui rebelled from Linqiu.

sentences.zh: 宣公卒，子康公貸立。

translations.literal: Xuan gong die, zi Kang gong Dai stand.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died, and his son Duke Kang Dai ascended.

sentences.zh: 貸立十四年，淫於酒婦人，不聽政。

translations.literal: Dai stand fourteen years, yin yu jiu woman person, not listen zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Dai had been established fourteen years, debauched with wine and women, not attending to governance.

sentences.zh: 太公乃遷康公於海上，食一城，以奉其先祀。

translations.literal: Tai gong then move Kang gong yu hai shang, shi one cheng, with honor its first ji.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Gong then moved Duke Kang to the seacoast, giving him one city to eat from, to maintain the ancestral sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 明年，魯敗齊平陸。

translations.literal: Next year, Lu defeat Qi Ping Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Lu defeated Qi at Pinglu.

translations.literal: Duke Xuan died, and his son Duke Kang Dai ascended. Dai had been established fourteen years, debauched with wine and women, not attending to governance. Tai Gong then moved Duke Kang to the seacoast, giving him one city to eat from, to maintain the ancestral sacrifices. The next year, Lu defeated Qi at Pinglu.

sentences.zh: 齊侯太公和立二年，和卒，子桓公午立。

translations.literal: Qi hou Tai gong He stand two years, He die, zi Huan gong Wu stand.
translations.idiomatic: Qi marquis Tai Gong He had been established two years when He died, and his son Duke Huan Wu ascended.

sentences.zh: 桓公午五年，秦、魏攻韓，韓求救於齊。

translations.literal: Huan gong Wu five years, Qin, Wei attack Han, Han seek save yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huan Wu's fifth year, Qin and Wei attacked Han, and Han sought aid from Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公召大臣而謀曰：「蚤救之孰與晚救之？」

translations.literal: Qi Huan gong zhao da minister yet plan said: 'Early save it shu with late save it?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi summoned his ministers and plotted: 'Which is better—to save them early or late?'

sentences.zh: 騶忌曰：「不若勿救。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji said: 'Not if not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji said: 'It would be better not to save them.'

sentences.zh: 段干朋曰：「不救，則韓且折而入於魏，不若救之。」

translations.literal: Duan Gan Peng said: 'Not save, then Han and break yet enter yu Wei, not if save it.'
translations.idiomatic: Duan Gan Peng said: 'If we do not save them, Han will break and enter Wei; it would be better to save them.'

sentences.zh: 田臣思曰：「過矣君之謀也！

translations.literal: Tian Chen Si said: 'Wrong, jun zhi plan!
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chen Si said: 'Your Lordship's plan is wrong!

sentences.zh: 秦、魏攻韓、楚，趙必救之，是天以燕予齊也。」

translations.literal: Qin, Wei attack Han, Chu, Zhao must save it, is heaven with Yan yu Qi.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Wei attack Han and Chu; Zhao will certainly save them. This is Heaven giving Yan to Qi.'

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「善」。

translations.literal: Huan gong said: 'Good'.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 乃陰告韓使者而遣之。

translations.literal: Then yin tell Han shi zhe yet send it.
translations.idiomatic: Then secretly informed the Han envoy and sent him away.

sentences.zh: 韓自以為得齊之救，因與秦、魏戰。

translations.literal: Han self with get Qi zhi save, because with Qin, Wei battle.
translations.idiomatic: Han, thinking they had obtained Qi's aid, therefore fought with Qin and Wei.

sentences.zh: 楚、趙聞之，果起兵而救之。

translations.literal: Chu, Zhao hear it, fruit rise troops yet save it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu and Zhao heard of it and indeed raised troops to save them.

sentences.zh: 齊因起兵襲燕國，取桑丘。

translations.literal: Qi because rise troops attack Yan country, take Sang Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi therefore raised troops to attack Yan and took Sangqiu.

translations.literal: Qi marquis Tai Gong He had been established two years when He died, and his son Duke Huan Wu ascended. In Duke Huan Wu's fifth year, Qin and Wei attacked Han, and Han sought aid from Qi. Duke Huan of Qi summoned his ministers and plotted: 'Which is better—to save them early or late?' Zou Ji said: 'It would be better not to save them.' Duan Gan Peng said: 'If we do not save them, Han will break and enter Wei; it would be better to save them.' Tian Chen Si said: 'Your Lordship's plan is wrong! Qin and Wei attack Han and Chu; Zhao will certainly save them. This is Heaven giving Yan to Qi.' Duke Huan said: 'Good.' Then secretly informed the Han envoy and sent him away. Han, thinking they had obtained Qi's aid, therefore fought with Qin and Wei. Chu and Zhao heard of it and indeed raised troops to save them. Qi therefore raised troops to attack Yan and took Sangqiu.

sentences.zh: 六年，救衛。

translations.literal: Six years, save Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they saved Wei.

sentences.zh: 桓公卒，子威王因齊立。

translations.literal: Huan gong die, zi Wei wang Yin Qi stand.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died, and his son King Wei Yin Qi ascended.

sentences.zh: 是歲，故齊康公卒，絕無後，奉邑皆入田氏。

translations.literal: This year, old Qi Kang gong die, cut no after, honor yi all enter Tian shi.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, the former Duke Kang of Qi died without heirs, and all his fief territories entered the Tian clan.

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they saved Wei. Duke Huan died, and his son King Wei Yin Qi ascended. In this year, the former Duke Kang of Qi died without heirs, and all his fief territories entered the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 騶忌子以鼓琴見威王，威王說而捨之右室。

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi with drum qin see Wei wang, Wei wang shuo yet sha it right shi.
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi presented himself to King Wei by playing the qin, and King Wei was pleased and housed him in the right chamber.

sentences.zh: 須臾，王鼓琴，騶忌子推戶入曰：「善哉鼓琴！」

translations.literal: Xu yu, wang drum qin, Zou Ji zi push hu enter said: 'Good, drum qin!'
translations.idiomatic: After a moment, the king played the qin, and Zou Ji Zi pushed open the door and entered, saying: 'Excellent qin playing!'

sentences.zh: 王勃然不說，去琴按劍曰：「夫子見容未察，何以知其善也？」

translations.literal: Wang bo ran not shuo, go qin press sword said: 'Fu zi see rong not cha, what with know its good?'
translations.idiomatic: The king suddenly displeased, set aside the qin and pressed his sword, saying: 'Sir, you have seen the appearance but not examined closely; how do you know it is good?'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「夫大弦濁以春溫者，君也；

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Fu da xian zhuo with chun wen ones, jun;
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'The deep booming of the thick strings like spring warmth is the ruler;

sentences.zh: 小弦廉折以清者，相也；

translations.literal: Little xian lian zhe with qing ones, xiang;
translations.idiomatic: The sharp clarity of the thin strings is the chancellor;

sentences.zh: 攫之深，醳之愉者，政令也；

translations.literal: Jue zhi deep, tai zhi yu ones, zheng ling;
translations.idiomatic: The deep plucking and smooth release is governance and commands;

sentences.zh: 鈞諧以鳴，大小相益，回邪而不相害者，四時也：吾是以知其善也。」

translations.literal: Gou xie with ming, big small each yi, hui xie yet not each hai ones, four shi: I with is know its good.'
translations.idiomatic: The balanced harmony in sound, large and small mutually benefiting, winding and turning without harming each other is the four seasons. This is why I know it is good.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「善語音。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Good speak sound.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Excellent discourse on music.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「何獨語音，夫治國家而弭人民皆在其中。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'What alone speak sound, fu treat state family yet mi people people all in among.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'Why speak only of music? Governing the state and pacifying the people are all contained within it.'

sentences.zh: 王又勃然不說曰：「若夫語五音之紀，信未有如夫子者也。

translations.literal: Wang again bo ran not shuo said: 'If fu speak five sound zhi ji, believe not have like fu zi ones.
translations.idiomatic: The king again suddenly displeased, said: 'As for discourse on the principles of the five tones, truly there is none like you.

sentences.zh: 若夫治國家而弭人民，又何為乎絲桐之閒？」

translations.literal: If fu treat state family yet mi people people, again what become hu si tong zhi jian?'
translations.idiomatic: As for governing the state and pacifying the people, what has it to do with the space between silk and paulownia?'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「夫大弦濁以春溫者，君也；

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Fu da xian zhuo with chun wen ones, jun;
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'The deep booming of the thick strings like spring warmth is the ruler;

sentences.zh: 小弦廉折以清者，相也；

translations.literal: Little xian lian zhe with qing ones, xiang;
translations.idiomatic: The sharp clarity of the thin strings is the chancellor;

sentences.zh: 攫之深而捨之愉者，政令也；

translations.literal: Jue zhi deep yet sha zhi yu ones, zheng ling;
translations.idiomatic: The deep plucking and smooth release is governance and commands;

sentences.zh: 鈞諧以鳴，大小相益，回邪而不相害者，四時也。

translations.literal: Gou xie with ming, big small each yi, hui xie yet not each hai ones, four shi.
translations.idiomatic: The balanced harmony in sound, large and small mutually benefiting, winding and turning without harming each other is the four seasons.

sentences.zh: 夫復而不亂者，所以治昌也；

translations.literal: Fu fu yet not chaos ones, so with treat chang;
translations.idiomatic: The repeated yet not disordered is what governs flourishing;

sentences.zh: 連而徑者，所以存亡也：故曰琴音調而天下治。

translations.literal: Lian yet jing ones, so with save perish: therefore said qin sound diao yet tian xia treat.
translations.idiomatic: The connected yet direct is what preserves existence: therefore it is said that when the qin's sound is harmonious, the empire is governed.

sentences.zh: 夫治國家而弭人民者，無若乎五音者。」

translations.literal: Fu treat state family yet mi people people ones, no if hu five sound ones.'
translations.idiomatic: For governing the state and pacifying the people, nothing compares to the five tones.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Good.'

translations.literal: Zou Ji Zi presented himself to King Wei by playing the qin, and King Wei was pleased and housed him in the right chamber. After a moment, the king played the qin, and Zou Ji Zi pushed open the door and entered, saying: 'Excellent qin playing!' The king suddenly displeased, set aside the qin and pressed his sword, saying: 'Sir, you have seen the appearance but not examined closely; how do you know it is good?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'The deep booming of the thick strings like spring warmth is the ruler; The sharp clarity of the thin strings is the chancellor; The deep plucking and smooth release is governance and commands; The balanced harmony in sound, large and small mutually benefiting, winding and turning without harming each other is the four seasons. This is why I know it is good.' The king said: 'Excellent discourse on music.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'Why speak only of music? Governing the state and pacifying the people are all contained within it.' The king again suddenly displeased, said: 'As for discourse on the principles of the five tones, truly there is none like you. As for governing the state and pacifying the people, what has it to do with the space between silk and paulownia?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'The deep booming of the thick strings like spring warmth is the ruler; The sharp clarity of the thin strings is the chancellor; The deep plucking and smooth release is governance and commands; The balanced harmony in sound, large and small mutually benefiting, winding and turning without harming each other is the four seasons. The repeated yet not disordered is what governs flourishing; The connected yet direct is what preserves existence: therefore it is said that when the qin's sound is harmonious, the empire is governed. For governing the state and pacifying the people, nothing compares to the five tones.' The king said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子見三月而受相印。

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi see three month yet receive xiang yin.
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi had been seen for three months when he received the chancellor's seal.

sentences.zh: 淳于髡見之曰：「善說哉！

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun see it said: 'Good shuo!
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun saw him and said: 'Excellent persuasion!

sentences.zh: 髡有愚志，願陳諸前。」

translations.literal: Kun have yu zhi, wish chen zhu front.'
translations.idiomatic: Kun has a foolish plan that I wish to lay before you.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「謹受教。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Respect receive teach.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive instruction.'

sentences.zh: 淳于髡曰：「得全全昌，失全全亡。」

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun said: 'Get all all chang, lose all all perish.'
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun said: 'If you gain all, all flourishes; if you lose all, all perishes.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹毋離前。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Respect receive ling, request respect no li front.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully not depart from what is before.'

sentences.zh: 淳于髡曰：「狶膏棘軸，所以為滑也，然而不能運方穿。」

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun said: 'Xi gao ji zhou, so with become hua, yet not able transport fang chuan.'
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun said: 'Xi grease and thorn axles make for smoothness, yet cannot move square holes.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹事左右。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Respect receive ling, request respect shi left right.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully serve the attendants.'

sentences.zh: 淳于髡曰：「弓膠昔干，所以為合也，然而不能傅合疏罅。」

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun said: 'Bow jiao xi gan, so with become he, yet not able fu he shu xia.'
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun said: 'Bow glue and Xi wood make for joining, yet cannot fill wide cracks.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹自附於萬民。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Respect receive ling, request respect self attach yu wan min.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully attach myself to the ten thousand people.'

sentences.zh: 淳于髡曰：「狐裘雖敝，不可補以黃狗之皮。」

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun said: 'Hu qiu though bi, not able bu with huang gou zhi pi.'
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun said: 'Though a fox fur robe is worn, it cannot be patched with yellow dog skin.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹擇君子，毋雜小人其閒。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Respect receive ling, request respect choose jun zi, no za little person its jian.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully choose worthy men and not mix petty men among them.'

sentences.zh: 淳于髡曰：「大車不較，不能載其常任；

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun said: 'Big vehicle not jiao, not able load its constant ren;
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun said: 'A large cart without linchpins cannot carry its regular load;

sentences.zh: 琴瑟不較，不能成其五音。」

translations.literal: Qin se not jiao, not able become its five sound.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin and se without linchpins cannot complete their five tones.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹修法律而督姦吏。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Respect receive ling, request respect repair fa lu yet du jian li.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully repair the laws and oversee corrupt officials.'

sentences.zh: 淳于髡說畢，趨出，至門，而面其仆曰：「是人者，吾語之微言五，其應我若響之應聲，是人必封不久矣。」

translations.literal: Chun Yu Kun shuo finish, qu out, reach men, yet face its pu said: 'This person, I speak it wei yan five, its ying I if xiang zhi ying sheng, this person must seal not long.'
translations.idiomatic: Chunyu Kun finished speaking, hurried out, reached the gate, and turned to face his charioteer: 'This man—I spoke five subtle words to him, and he responded to me like an echo responds to sound. This man will certainly be enfeoffed before long.'

sentences.zh: 居朞，封以下邳，號曰成侯。

translations.literal: Ju ji, seal with Xia Pi, number said Cheng hou.
translations.idiomatic: After a season, he was enfeoffed with Xiapi, titled Cheng Hou.

translations.literal: Zou Ji Zi had been seen for three months when he received the chancellor's seal. Chunyu Kun saw him and said: 'Excellent persuasion! Kun has a foolish plan that I wish to lay before you.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive instruction.' Chunyu Kun said: 'If you gain all, all flourishes; if you lose all, all perishes.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully not depart from what is before.' Chunyu Kun said: 'Xi grease and thorn axles make for smoothness, yet cannot move square holes.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully serve the attendants.' Chunyu Kun said: 'Bow glue and Xi wood make for joining, yet cannot fill wide cracks.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully attach myself to the ten thousand people.' Chunyu Kun said: 'Though a fox fur robe is worn, it cannot be patched with yellow dog skin.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully choose worthy men and not mix petty men among them.' Chunyu Kun said: 'A large cart without linchpins cannot carry its regular load; Qin and se without linchpins cannot complete their five tones.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully repair the laws and oversee corrupt officials.' Chunyu Kun finished speaking, hurried out, reached the gate, and turned to face his charioteer: 'This man—I spoke five subtle words to him, and he responded to me like an echo responds to sound. This man will certainly be enfeoffed before long.' After a season, he was enfeoffed with Xiapi, titled Cheng Hou.

sentences.zh: 威王二十三年，與趙王會平陸。

translations.literal: Wei wang twenty three years, with Zhao wang hui Ping Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wei's twenty-third year, he met with the King of Zhao at Pinglu.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與魏王會田於郊。

translations.literal: Twenty four years, with Wei wang hui tian yu jiao.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the King of Wei for a hunt in the suburbs.

sentences.zh: 魏王問曰：「王亦有寶乎？」

translations.literal: Wei wang ask said: 'Wang also have treasure?'
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wei asked: 'Does Your Majesty also have treasures?'

sentences.zh: 威王曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'No have.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wei said: 'None.'

sentences.zh: 梁王曰：「若寡人國小也，尚有徑寸之珠照車前後各十二乘者十枚，奈何以萬乘之國而無寶乎？」

translations.literal: Liang wang said: 'If gua person country little, still have jing cun zhi zhu zhao vehicle before after each twelve sheng ones ten mei, nai he with wan sheng zhi country yet no treasure?'
translations.idiomatic: The King of Liang said: 'Though my kingdom is small, I still have pearls one inch in diameter that illuminate twelve chariots before and behind, ten pairs of them. How can a kingdom of ten thousand chariots have no treasures?'

sentences.zh: 威王曰：「寡人之所以為寶與王異。

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'Gua person so with become treasure with wang different.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wei said: 'What I consider treasures differs from Your Majesty's.

sentences.zh: 吾臣有檀子者，使守南城，則楚人不敢為寇東取，泗上十二諸侯皆來朝。

translations.literal: I minister have Tan zi ones, make shou Nan cheng, then Chu person not dare become kou dong take, Si shang twelve various hou all come court.
translations.idiomatic: I have a minister named Tan Zi; when I had him defend Nancheng, the Chu people dared not raid eastward, and the twelve feudal lords above the Si all came to court.

sentences.zh: 吾臣有子者，使守高唐，則趙人不敢東漁於河。

translations.literal: I minister have Zi ones, make shou Gao Tang, then Zhao person not dare dong yu yu he.
translations.idiomatic: I have a minister named Zi; when I had him defend Gaotang, the Zhao people dared not fish eastward on the river.

sentences.zh: 吾吏有黔夫者，使守徐州，則燕人祭北門，趙人祭西門，徙而從者七千餘家。

translations.literal: I li have Qian Fu ones, make shou Xu zhou, then Yan person ji bei men, Zhao person ji xi men, move yet follow ones seven thousand yu home.
translations.idiomatic: I have an official named Qian Fu; when I had him defend Xuzhou, the Yan people sacrificed at the north gate, the Zhao people at the west gate, and those who moved to follow him numbered over seven thousand households.

sentences.zh: 吾臣有種首者，使備盜賊，則道不拾遺。

translations.literal: I minister have Zhong Shou ones, make bei dao zei, then dao not shi yi.
translations.idiomatic: I have a minister named Zhong Shou; when I had him prepare against bandits, the roads were free of lost items.

sentences.zh: 將以照千里，豈特十二乘哉！」

translations.literal: Will with zhao thousand li, qi te twelve sheng!'
translations.idiomatic: These illuminate a thousand li—how merely twelve chariots!'

sentences.zh: 梁惠王慚，不懌而去。

translations.literal: Liang Hui wang can, not yi go.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui of Liang was ashamed and displeased as he departed.

translations.literal: In King Wei's twenty-third year, he met with the King of Zhao at Pinglu. In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the King of Wei for a hunt in the suburbs. The King of Wei asked: 'Does Your Majesty also have treasures?' King Wei said: 'None.' The King of Liang said: 'Though my kingdom is small, I still have pearls one inch in diameter that illuminate twelve chariots before and behind, ten pairs of them. How can a kingdom of ten thousand chariots have no treasures?' King Wei said: 'What I consider treasures differs from Your Majesty's. I have a minister named Tan Zi; when I had him defend Nancheng, the Chu people dared not raid eastward, and the twelve feudal lords above the Si all came to court. I have a minister named Zi; when I had him defend Gaotang, the Zhao people dared not fish eastward on the river. I have an official named Qian Fu; when I had him defend Xuzhou, the Yan people sacrificed at the north gate, the Zhao people at the west gate, and those who moved to follow him numbered over seven thousand households. I have a minister named Zhong Shou; when I had him prepare against bandits, the roads were free of lost items. These illuminate a thousand li—how merely twelve chariots!' King Hui of Liang was ashamed and displeased as he departed.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，魏惠王圍邯鄲，趙求救於齊。

translations.literal: Twenty six years, Wei Hui wang surround Han Dan, Zhao seek save yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, King Hui of Wei besieged Handan, and Zhao sought aid from Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊威王召大臣而謀曰：「救趙孰與勿救？」

translations.literal: Qi Wei wang zhao da minister yet plan said: 'Save Zhao shu with not save?'
translations.idiomatic: King Wei of Qi summoned his ministers and plotted: 'To save Zhao or not to save?'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「不如勿救。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Not if not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'It would be better not to save them.'

sentences.zh: 段干朋曰：「不救則不義，且不利。」

translations.literal: Duan Gan Peng said: 'Not save then not yi, and not li.'
translations.idiomatic: Duan Gan Peng said: 'Not saving would be unrighteous, and moreover disadvantageous.'

sentences.zh: 威王曰：「何也？」

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'What?'
translations.idiomatic: King Wei said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「夫魏氏并邯鄲，其於齊何利哉？

translations.literal: Answer said: 'Fu Wei shi bing Han Dan, its yu Qi what li?
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'If Wei swallows Handan, what benefit to Qi?

sentences.zh: 且夫救趙而軍其郊，是趙不伐而魏全也。

translations.literal: And fu save Zhao yet army its jiao, is Zhao not attack yet Wei full.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, to save Zhao by stationing troops in its suburbs means Zhao is not attacked while Wei is preserved intact.

sentences.zh: 故不如南攻襄陵以獘魏，邯鄲拔而乘魏之獘。」

translations.literal: Therefore not if nan attack Xiang Ling with bi Wei, Han Dan ba yet sheng Wei zhi bi.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it would be better to attack Xiangling in the south to weaken Wei, then when Handan falls, take advantage of Wei's weakness.'

sentences.zh: 威王從其計。

translations.literal: Wei wang follow its plan.
translations.idiomatic: King Wei followed this plan.

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, King Hui of Wei besieged Handan, and Zhao sought aid from Qi. King Wei of Qi summoned his ministers and plotted: 'To save Zhao or not to save?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'It would be better not to save them.' Duan Gan Peng said: 'Not saving would be unrighteous, and moreover disadvantageous.' King Wei said: 'Why?' He replied: 'If Wei swallows Handan, what benefit to Qi? Moreover, to save Zhao by stationing troops in its suburbs means Zhao is not attacked while Wei is preserved intact. Therefore it would be better to attack Xiangling in the south to weaken Wei, then when Handan falls, take advantage of Wei's weakness.' King Wei followed this plan.

sentences.zh: 其後成侯騶忌與田忌不善，公孫閱謂成侯忌曰：「公何不謀伐魏，田忌必將。

translations.literal: Its after Cheng hou Zou Ji with Tian Ji not good, Gong Sun Yue wei Cheng hou Ji said: 'Gong what not plan attack Wei, Tian Ji must jiang.'
translations.idiomatic: Later, Cheng Hou Zou Ji and Tian Ji were on bad terms, and Gongsun Yue spoke to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not plot to attack Wei? Tian Ji will certainly command.

sentences.zh: 戰勝有功，則公之謀中也；

translations.literal: Battle win have merit, then gong zhi plan zhong;
translations.idiomatic: If victorious with merit, then Your Lordship's plot succeeds;

sentences.zh: 戰不勝，非前死則後北，而命在公矣。」

translations.literal: Battle not win, not before die then after bei, yet ming in gong.'
translations.idiomatic: If not victorious, he will either die in front or flee behind, and his fate will be in Your Lordship's hands.'

sentences.zh: 於是成侯言威王，使田忌南攻襄陵。

translations.literal: Then Cheng hou yan Wei wang, make Tian Ji nan attack Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Then Cheng Hou spoke to King Wei, sending Tian Ji to attack Xiangling in the south.

sentences.zh: 十月，邯鄲拔，齊因起兵擊魏，大敗之桂陵。

translations.literal: Ten month, Han Dan ba, Qi because rise troops strike Wei, big defeat it Gui Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Handan fell, and Qi therefore raised troops to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Guiling.

sentences.zh: 于是齊最彊于諸侯，自稱為王，以令天下。

translations.literal: Then Qi most qiang yu various hou, self name become wang, with ling tian xia.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qi was strongest among the feudal lords, self-styled as king, to command the empire.

translations.literal: Later, Cheng Hou Zou Ji and Tian Ji were on bad terms, and Gongsun Yue spoke to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not plot to attack Wei? Tian Ji will certainly command. If victorious with merit, then Your Lordship's plot succeeds; If not victorious, he will either die in front or flee behind, and his fate will be in Your Lordship's hands.' Then Cheng Hou spoke to King Wei, sending Tian Ji to attack Xiangling in the south. In the tenth month, Handan fell, and Qi therefore raised troops to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Guiling. Then Qi was strongest among the feudal lords, self-styled as king, to command the empire.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，殺其大夫牟辛。

translations.literal: Thirty three years, kill its da fu Mou Xin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, he killed his grandee Mou Xin.

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, he killed his grandee Mou Xin.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，公孫閱又謂成侯忌曰：「公何不令人操十金卜於市，曰『我田忌之人也。

translations.literal: Thirty five years, Gong Sun Yue again wei Cheng hou Ji said: 'Gong what not make person cao ten jin bu yu shi, said 'I Tian Ji zhi person.'
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Gongsun Yue again spoke to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not have someone take ten jin to divine in the market, saying 'I am Tian Ji's man.

sentences.zh: 吾三戰而三勝，聲威天下。

translations.literal: I three battle yet three win, sheng wei tian xia.'
translations.idiomatic: I have fought three battles and won three times, my fame and might shaking the empire.'

sentences.zh: 欲為大事，亦吉乎不吉乎』？」

translations.literal: Desire become big shi, also ji not ji?'
translations.idiomatic: If I desire to do great things, will it be auspicious or inauspicious?'

sentences.zh: 卜者出，因令人捕為之卜者，驗其辭於王之所。

translations.literal: Bu ones out, because make person bu wei it bu ones, yan its ci yu wang zhi place.
translations.idiomatic: The diviner went out, and they had someone arrest the diviner, verifying the words in the king's presence.

sentences.zh: 田忌聞之，因率其徒襲攻臨淄，求成侯，不勝而奔。

translations.literal: Tian Ji hear it, because lead its tu attack Lin Zi, seek Cheng hou, not win yet ben.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Ji heard of it and therefore led his followers to attack Linzi by surprise, seeking Cheng Hou, but did not prevail and fled.

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Gongsun Yue again spoke to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not have someone take ten jin to divine in the market, saying 'I am Tian Ji's man. I have fought three battles and won three times, my fame and might shaking the empire.' If I desire to do great things, will it be auspicious or inauspicious?' The diviner went out, and they had someone arrest the diviner, verifying the words in the king's presence. Tian Ji heard of it and therefore led his followers to attack Linzi by surprise, seeking Cheng Hou, but did not prevail and fled.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，威王卒，子宣王辟彊立。

translations.literal: Thirty six years, Wei wang die, zi Xuan wang Pi Qiang stand.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, King Wei died, and his son King Xuan Pi Qiang ascended.

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, King Wei died, and his son King Xuan Pi Qiang ascended.

sentences.zh: 二年，魏伐趙。

translations.literal: Two years, Wei attack Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Wei attacked Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙與韓親，共擊魏。

translations.literal: Zhao with Han qin, together strike Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao and Han were close and together attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 趙不利，戰於南梁。

translations.literal: Zhao not li, battle yu Nan Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao was disadvantaged and fought at Nanliang.

sentences.zh: 宣王召田忌復故位。

translations.literal: Xuan wang zhao Tian Ji fu old wei.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan summoned Tian Ji to restore his former position.

sentences.zh: 韓氏請救於齊。

translations.literal: Han shi request save yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The Han clan requested aid from Qi.

sentences.zh: 宣王召大臣而謀曰：「蚤救孰與晚救？」

translations.literal: Xuan wang zhao da minister yet plan said: 'Early save shu with late save?'
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan summoned his ministers and plotted: 'To save early or late?'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子曰：「不如勿救。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji zi said: 'Not if not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Zou Ji Zi said: 'It would be better not to save.'

sentences.zh: 田忌曰：「弗救，則韓且折而入於魏，不如蚤救之。」

translations.literal: Tian Ji said: 'Not save, then Han and break yet enter yu Wei, not if early save it.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Ji said: 'If we do not save them, Han will break and enter Wei; it would be better to save them early.'

sentences.zh: 孫子曰：「夫韓、魏之兵未獘而救之，是吾代韓受魏之兵，顧反聽命於韓也。

translations.literal: Sun zi said: 'Fu Han, Wei zhi troops not bi yet save it, is I dai Han receive Wei zhi troops, gu return listen ming yu Han.
translations.idiomatic: Sun Zi said: 'If we save them when Han and Wei's troops are not yet weakened, we will take Han's place receiving Wei's troops, and moreover take orders from Han instead.

sentences.zh: 且魏有破國之志，韓見亡，必東面而愬於齊矣。

translations.literal: And Wei have break country zhi zhi, Han see perish, must dong face yet su yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Wei has the intention to destroy states; when Han sees destruction, they will certainly face east and appeal to Qi.

sentences.zh: 吾因深結韓之親而晚承魏之獘，則可重利而得尊名也。」

translations.literal: I because deep jie Han zhi qin yet late cheng Wei zhi bi, then able zhong li yet get zun ming.'
translations.idiomatic: We can deeply bind with Han's friendship and late receive Wei's weakness, then obtain great benefit and honorable name.'

sentences.zh: 宣王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Xuan wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 乃陰告韓之使者而遣之。

translations.literal: Then yin tell Han zhi shi zhe yet send it.
translations.idiomatic: Then secretly informed Han's envoy and sent him away.

sentences.zh: 韓因恃齊，五戰不勝，而東委國於齊。

translations.literal: Han because shi Qi, five battle not win, yet dong wei country yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Han therefore relied on Qi, fought five battles without victory, and entrusted their kingdom to Qi in the east.

sentences.zh: 齊因起兵，使田忌、田嬰將，孫子為（帥）［師］，救韓、趙以擊魏，大敗之馬陵，殺其將龐涓，虜魏太子申。

translations.literal: Qi because rise troops, make Tian Ji, Tian Ying jiang, Sun zi become (shuai) [shi], save Han, Zhao with strike Wei, big defeat it Ma Ling, kill its jiang Pang Juan, lu Wei crown prince Shen.
translations.idiomatic: Qi therefore raised troops, with Tian Ji and Tian Ying as generals and Sun Zi as strategist, saving Han and Zhao to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Maling, killing their general Pang Juan and capturing Wei's crown prince Shen.

sentences.zh: 其後三晉之王皆因田嬰朝齊王於博望，盟而去。

translations.literal: Its after three Jin zhi wang all because Tian Ying court Qi wang yu Bo Wang, meng yet go.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, the kings of the three Jin all came through Tian Ying to court the Qi king at Bowang, made covenant, and departed.

translations.literal: In the second year, Wei attacked Zhao. Zhao and Han were close and together attacked Wei. Zhao was disadvantaged and fought at Nanliang. King Xuan summoned Tian Ji to restore his former position. The Han clan requested aid from Qi. King Xuan summoned his ministers and plotted: 'To save early or late?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'It would be better not to save.' Tian Ji said: 'If we do not save them, Han will break and enter Wei; it would be better to save them early.' Sun Zi said: 'If we save them when Han and Wei's troops are not yet weakened, we will take Han's place receiving Wei's troops, and moreover take orders from Han instead. Moreover, Wei has the intention to destroy states; when Han sees destruction, they will certainly face east and appeal to Qi. We can deeply bind with Han's friendship and late receive Wei's weakness, then obtain great benefit and honorable name.' King Xuan said: 'Good.' Then secretly informed Han's envoy and sent him away. Han therefore relied on Qi, fought five battles without victory, and entrusted their kingdom to Qi in the east. Qi therefore raised troops, with Tian Ji and Tian Ying as generals and Sun Zi as strategist, saving Han and Zhao to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Maling, killing their general Pang Juan and capturing Wei's crown prince Shen. Afterward, the kings of the three Jin all came through Tian Ying to court the Qi king at Bowang, made covenant, and departed.

sentences.zh: 七年，與魏王會平阿南。

translations.literal: Seven years, with Wei wang hui Ping A nan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he met with the Wei king south of Ping'a.

sentences.zh: 明年，復會甄。

translations.literal: Next year, again hui Zhen.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, he met again at Zhen.

sentences.zh: 魏惠王卒。

translations.literal: Wei Hui wang die.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui of Wei died.

sentences.zh: 明年，與魏襄王會徐州，諸侯相王也。

translations.literal: Next year, with Wei Xiang wang hui Xu zhou, various hou each wang.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, he met with King Xiang of Wei at Xuzhou, where the feudal lords styled each other as kings.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚圍我徐州。

translations.literal: Ten years, Chu surround I Xu zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Chu besieged our Xuzhou.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與魏伐趙，趙決河水灌齊、魏，兵罷。

translations.literal: Eleven years, with Wei attack Zhao, Zhao decide river water guan Qi, Wei, troops stop.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, together with Wei they attacked Zhao, but Zhao breached the river waters to flood Qi and Wei, and the troops withdrew.

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he met with the Wei king south of Ping'a. The next year, he met again at Zhen. King Hui of Wei died. The next year, he met with King Xiang of Wei at Xuzhou, where the feudal lords styled each other as kings. In the tenth year, Chu besieged our Xuzhou. In the eleventh year, together with Wei they attacked Zhao, but Zhao breached the river waters to flood Qi and Wei, and the troops withdrew.

sentences.zh: 十八年，宣王喜文學游說之士，自如騶衍、淳于髡、田駢、接子、慎到、環淵之徒七十六人，皆賜列第，為上大夫，不治而議論。

translations.literal: Eighteen years, Xuan wang hi wen xue you shuo zhi shi, self ru Zou Yan, Chun Yu Kun, Tian Pian, Jie zi, Shen Dao, Huan Yuan zhi tu seventy six people, all ci lie di, become shang da fu, not treat yet yi lun.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, King Xuan delighted in literary scholars and persuaders, such as Zou Yan, Chunyu Kun, Tian Pian, Jie Zi, Shen Dao, Huan Yuan and their followers, seventy-six men, all granted mansions in rows, made upper grandees, exempt from administration to engage in discussion.

sentences.zh: 是以齊稷下學士復盛，且數百千人。

translations.literal: With is Qi Ji xia xue shi again sheng, and number hundred thousand person.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the scholars at Jixia flourished again, numbering several hundred to a thousand.

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, King Xuan delighted in literary scholars and persuaders, such as Zou Yan, Chunyu Kun, Tian Pian, Jie Zi, Shen Dao, Huan Yuan and their followers, seventy-six men, all granted mansions in rows, made upper grandees, exempt from administration to engage in discussion. Therefore the scholars at Jixia flourished again, numbering several hundred to a thousand.

sentences.zh: 十九年，宣王卒，子湣王地立。

translations.literal: Nineteen years, Xuan wang die, zi Min wang Di stand.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, King Xuan died, and his son King Min Di ascended.

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, King Xuan died, and his son King Min Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 十二年，攻魏。

translations.literal: Twelve years, attack Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 楚圍雍氏，秦敗屈丐。

translations.literal: Chu surround Yong shi, Qin defeat Qu Gai.
translations.idiomatic: Chu besieged Yongshi, and Qin defeated Qu Gai.

sentences.zh: 蘇代謂田軫曰：「臣願有謁於公，其為事甚完，使楚利公，成為福，不成亦為福。

translations.literal: Su Dai wei Tian Zhen said: 'Minister wish have ye yu gong, its become shi very complete, make Chu li gong, become fu, not become also become fu.'
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai spoke to Tian Zhen: 'I wish to have an audience with you; this matter is very complete, making Chu benefit you—if successful it becomes fortune, if not it also becomes fortune.

sentences.zh: 今者臣立於門，客有言曰魏王謂韓馮、張儀曰：『煮棗將拔，齊兵又進，子來救寡人則可矣；

translations.literal: Now ones minister stand yu men, guest have yan said Wei wang wei Han Feng, Zhang Yi said: 'Zhu zao will ba, Qi troops again jin, zi come save gua person then able;
translations.idiomatic: Just now as I stood at the gate, a guest said the Wei king told Han Feng and Zhang Yi: 'The cooked jujube is about to be plucked, Qi troops advance again; if you come save me it will be fine;

sentences.zh: 不救寡人，寡人弗能拔。』

translations.literal: Not save gua person, gua person not able ba.'
translations.idiomatic: If you do not save me, I cannot pluck it.'

sentences.zh: 此特轉辭也。

translations.literal: This special zhuan ci.
translations.idiomatic: This is merely persuasive words.

sentences.zh: 秦、韓之兵毋東，旬餘，則魏氏轉韓從秦，秦逐張儀，交臂而事齊楚，此公之事成也。」

translations.literal: Qin, Han zhi troops no dong, xun yu, then Wei shi zhuan Han follow Qin, Qin zhui Zhang Yi, jiao bi yet shi Qi Chu, this gong zhi shi become.'
translations.idiomatic: If Qin and Han's troops do not go east, in ten days more, then Wei will turn Han to follow Qin, Qin will drive out Zhang Yi, and join arms to serve Qi and Chu—this will complete your lordship's affair.'

sentences.zh: 田軫曰：「柰何使無東？」

translations.literal: Tian Zhen said: 'Nai he make no dong?'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zhen said: 'How to make them not go east?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「韓馮之救魏之辭，必不謂韓王曰『馮以為魏』，必曰『馮將以秦韓之兵東卻齊宋，馮因摶三國之兵，乘屈丐之獘，南割於楚，故地必盡得之矣』。

translations.literal: Answer said: 'Han Feng zhi save Wei zhi ci, must not wei Han wang said 'Feng with wei Wei', must said 'Feng will with Qin Han zhi troops dong que Qi Song, Feng because tun three country zhi troops, sheng Qu Gai zhi bi, nan ge yu Chu, old land must all get it.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Han Feng's words about saving Wei will certainly not say to the Han king 'Feng thinks of Wei', but will say 'Feng will use Qin and Han's troops to push back Qi and Song to the east, Feng will gather the three kingdoms' troops, take advantage of Qu Gai's weakness, carve territory from Chu to the south, and certainly regain all the old lands.'

sentences.zh: 張儀救魏之辭，必不謂秦王曰『儀以為魏』，必曰『儀且以秦韓之兵東距齊宋，儀將摶三國之兵，乘屈丐之獘，南割於楚，名存亡國，實伐三川而歸，此王業也』。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi save Wei zhi ci, must not wei Qin wang said 'Yi with wei Wei', must said 'Yi and with Qin Han zhi troops dong ju Qi Song, Yi will tun three country zhi troops, sheng Qu Gai zhi bi, nan ge yu Chu, name save perish country, real attack three Chuan yet return, this wang ye.'
