translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi's words about saving Wei will certainly not say to the Qin king 'Yi thinks of Wei', but will say 'Yi will use Qin and Han's troops to resist Qi and Song to the east, Yi will gather the three kingdoms' troops, take advantage of Qu Gai's weakness, carve territory from Chu to the south, nominally to save a perishing kingdom but actually to attack Sanchuan and return—this is kingly enterprise.'

sentences.zh: 公令楚王與韓氏地，使秦制和，謂秦王曰『請與韓地，而王以施三川，韓氏之兵不用而得地於楚』。

translations.literal: Gong make Chu wang with Han shi land, make Qin zhi he, wei Qin wang said 'Request with Han land, yet wang with shi three Chuan, Han shi zhi troops not use yet get land yu Chu'.
translations.idiomatic: Have the Chu king give land to Han, have Qin arrange peace, and tell the Qin king 'Please give land to Han, and Your Majesty bestow it on Sanchuan; Han's troops will not be used but you will gain land from Chu.'

sentences.zh: 韓馮之東兵之辭且謂秦何？

translations.literal: Han Feng zhi dong troops zhi ci and wei Qin what?
translations.idiomatic: What will Han Feng's words about sending troops east say to Qin?

sentences.zh: 曰『秦兵不用而得三川，伐楚韓以窘魏，魏氏不敢東，是孤齊也』。

translations.literal: Said 'Qin troops not use yet get three Chuan, attack Chu Han with qiong Wei, Wei shi not dare dong, is gu Qi.'
translations.idiomatic: He will say 'Qin troops not used but gain Sanchuan, attack Chu and Han to distress Wei, Wei will not dare go east, thus isolating Qi.'

sentences.zh: 張儀之東兵之辭且謂何？

translations.literal: Zhang Yi zhi dong troops zhi ci and wei what?
translations.idiomatic: What will Zhang Yi's words about sending troops east say?

sentences.zh: 曰『秦韓欲地而兵有案，聲威發於魏，魏氏之欲不失齊楚者有資矣』。

translations.literal: Said 'Qin Han desire land yet troops have an, sheng wei fa yu Wei, Wei shi zhi desire not lose Qi Chu ones have zi.'
translations.idiomatic: He will say 'Qin and Han desire land but troops are stationed, fame and might issue from Wei, Wei's desire not to lose Qi and Chu will be supported.'

sentences.zh: 魏氏轉秦韓爭事齊楚，楚王欲而無與地，公令秦韓之兵不用而得地，有一大德也。

translations.literal: Wei shi zhuan Qin Han zheng shi Qi Chu, Chu wang yu yet no yu land, gong make Qin Han zhi troops not use yet get land, have one big virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Wei will turn Qin and Han to vie in serving Qi and Chu; the Chu king desires this but has no land to give, you make Qin and Han's troops unused yet gain land—there is great virtue in this.

sentences.zh: 秦韓之王劫於韓馮、張儀而東兵以徇服魏，公常執左券以責於秦韓，此其善於公而惡張子多資矣。」

translations.literal: Qin Han zhi wang jie yu Han Feng, Zhang Yi yet dong troops with xun fu Wei, gong constant zhi left quan with ze yu Qin Han, this its shan yu gong yet wu Zhang zi duo zi.'
translations.idiomatic: The kings of Qin and Han will be coerced by Han Feng and Zhang Yi to send troops east to submit to Wei, you will constantly hold the left tally to demand from Qin and Han—this will be good for you but bad for Zhang Zi, providing much support.'

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he attacked Wei. Chu besieged Yongshi, and Qin defeated Qu Gai. Su Dai spoke to Tian Zhen: 'I wish to have an audience with you; this matter is very complete, making Chu benefit you—if successful it becomes fortune, if not it also becomes fortune. Just now as I stood at the gate, a guest said the Wei king told Han Feng and Zhang Yi: 'The cooked jujube is about to be plucked, Qi troops advance again; if you come save me it will be fine; If you do not save me, I cannot pluck it.' This is merely persuasive words. If Qin and Han's troops do not go east, in ten days more, then Wei will turn Han to follow Qin, Qin will drive out Zhang Yi, and join arms to serve Qi and Chu—this will complete your lordship's affair.' Tian Zhen said: 'How to make them not go east?' He replied: 'Han Feng's words about saving Wei will certainly not say to the Han king 'Feng thinks of Wei', but will say 'Feng will use Qin and Han's troops to push back Qi and Song to the east, Feng will gather the three kingdoms' troops, take advantage of Qu Gai's weakness, carve territory from Chu to the south, and certainly regain all the old lands.' Zhang Yi's words about saving Wei will certainly not say to the Qin king 'Yi thinks of Wei', but will say 'Yi will use Qin and Han's troops to resist Qi and Song to the east, Yi will gather the three kingdoms' troops, take advantage of Qu Gai's weakness, carve territory from Chu to the south, nominally to save a perishing kingdom but actually to attack Sanchuan and return—this is kingly enterprise.' Have the Chu king give land to Han, have Qin arrange peace, and tell the Qin king 'Please give land to Han, and Your Majesty bestow it on Sanchuan; Han's troops will not be used but you will gain land from Chu.' What will Han Feng's words about sending troops east say to Qin? He will say 'Qin troops not used but gain Sanchuan, attack Chu and Han to distress Wei, Wei will not dare go east, thus isolating Qi.' What will Zhang Yi's words about sending troops east say? He will say 'Qin and Han desire land but troops are stationed, fame and might issue from Wei, Wei's desire not to lose Qi and Chu will be supported.' Wei will turn Qin and Han to vie in serving Qi and Chu; the Chu king desires this but has no land to give, you make Qin and Han's troops unused yet gain land—there is great virtue in this. The kings of Qin and Han will be coerced by Han Feng and Zhang Yi to send troops east to submit to Wei, you will constantly hold the left tally to demand from Qin and Han—this will be good for you but bad for Zhang Zi, providing much support.'

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦惠王卒。

translations.literal: Thirteen years, Qin Hui wang die.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, King Hui of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，與秦擊敗楚於重丘。

translations.literal: Twenty three years, with Qin strike defeat Chu yu Chong Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, together with Qin they defeated Chu at Chongqiu.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，秦使涇陽君質於齊。

translations.literal: Twenty four years, Qin make Jing Yang jun zhi yu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Qin sent Lord Jingyang as hostage to Qi.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，歸涇陽君于秦。

translations.literal: Twenty five years, return Jing Yang jun yu Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, they returned Lord Jingyang to Qin.

sentences.zh: 孟嘗君薛文入秦，即相秦。

translations.literal: Meng Chang jun Xue Wen enter Qin, ji xiang Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Mengchang Xue Wen entered Qin and immediately became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 文亡去。

translations.literal: Wen perish go.
translations.idiomatic: Wen fled.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊與韓魏共攻秦，至函谷軍焉。

translations.literal: Twenty six years, Qi with Han Wei together attack Qin, reach Han Gu army yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi together with Han and Wei attacked Qin, reaching Hangu Pass where they encamped.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，秦與韓河外以和，兵罷。

translations.literal: Twenty eight years, Qin with Han river outside with he, troops stop.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin and Han made peace regarding the lands outside the river, and troops withdrew.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，趙殺其主父。

translations.literal: Twenty nine years, Zhao kill its zhu fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Zhao killed its Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 齊佐趙滅中山。

translations.literal: Qi zuo Zhao extinguish Zhong Shan.
translations.idiomatic: Qi aided Zhao in destroying Zhongshan.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, King Hui of Qin died. In the twenty-third year, together with Qin they defeated Chu at Chongqiu. In the twenty-fourth year, Qin sent Lord Jingyang as hostage to Qi. In the twenty-fifth year, they returned Lord Jingyang to Qin. Lord Mengchang Xue Wen entered Qin and immediately became chancellor of Qin. Wen fled. In the twenty-sixth year, Qi together with Han and Wei attacked Qin, reaching Hangu Pass where they encamped. In the twenty-eighth year, Qin and Han made peace regarding the lands outside the river, and troops withdrew. In the twenty-ninth year, Zhao killed its Lord Father. Qi aided Zhao in destroying Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，王為東帝，秦昭王為西帝。

translations.literal: Thirty six years, wang become dong di, Qin Zhao wang become xi di.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, the king became Eastern Emperor, and King Zhao of Qin became Western Emperor.

sentences.zh: 蘇代自燕來，入齊，見於章華東門。

translations.literal: Su Dai self Yan come, enter Qi, see yu Zhang Hua dong men.
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai came from Yan, entered Qi, and was seen at the east gate of Zhanghua Palace.

sentences.zh: 齊王曰：「嘻，善，子來！

translations.literal: Qi wang said: 'Xi, good, zi come!
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king said: 'Ah, good, you have come!

sentences.zh: 秦使魏冉致帝，子以為何如？」

translations.literal: Qin make Wei Ran zhi di, zi with wei what?'
translations.idiomatic: Qin has sent Wei Ran to confer the title of emperor; what do you think?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「王之問臣也卒，而患之所從來微，願王受之而勿備稱也。

translations.literal: Answer said: 'Wang zhi wen minister also zu, yet huan zhi place from come wei, wish wang receive it yet not bei cheng.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Your Majesty's question to me is abrupt, and the source of the trouble is subtle; I wish Your Majesty to accept it but not fully style yourself as such.

sentences.zh: 秦稱之，天下安之，王乃稱之，無後也。

translations.literal: Qin name it, tian xia an it, wang then name it, no after.
translations.idiomatic: If Qin styles itself as such and the empire accepts it, then Your Majesty may style yourself as such, with no harm.

sentences.zh: 且讓爭帝名，無傷也。

translations.literal: And let zheng di ming, no shang.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, yielding or contending for the emperor title does no harm.

sentences.zh: 秦稱之，天下惡之，王因勿稱，以收天下，此大資也。

translations.literal: Qin name it, tian xia wu it, wang because not name, with shou tian xia, this big zi.
translations.idiomatic: If Qin styles itself as such and the empire hates it, Your Majesty should therefore not style yourself as such, to gather the empire—this is great support.

sentences.zh: 且天下立兩帝，王以天下為尊齊乎？

translations.literal: And tian xia stand two di, wang with tian xia wei zun Qi?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if the empire establishes two emperors, does Your Majesty think the empire will honor Qi?

sentences.zh: 尊秦乎？」

translations.literal: Zun Qin?'
translations.idiomatic: Or honor Qin?'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「尊秦。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Zun Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Honor Qin.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「釋帝，天下愛齊乎？

translations.literal: Said: 'Shi di, tian xia ai Qi?
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If we relinquish the emperor title, will the empire love Qi?

sentences.zh: 愛秦乎？」

translations.literal: Ai Qin?'
translations.idiomatic: Or love Qin?'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「愛齊而憎秦。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Ai Qi yet zeng Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Love Qi and hate Qin.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「兩帝立約伐趙，孰與伐桀宋之利？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Two di stand yue attack Zhao, shu with attack Jie Song zhi li?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If the two emperors covenant to attack Zhao, which is more advantageous than attacking the wicked Song?'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「伐桀宋利。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Attack Jie Song li.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Attacking the wicked Song is advantageous.'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「夫約鈞，然與秦為帝而天下獨尊秦而輕齊，釋帝則天下愛齊而憎秦，伐趙不如伐桀宋之利，故願王明釋帝以收天下，倍約賓秦，無爭重，而王以其閒舉宋。

translations.literal: Answer said: 'Fu yue jun, yet with Qin become di yet tian xia alone zun Qin yet qing Qi, shi di then tian xia ai Qi yet zeng Qin, attack Zhao not if attack Jie Song zhi li, therefore wish wang ming shi di with shou tian xia, bei yue bin Qin, no zheng zhong, yet wang with its jian ju Song.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The covenants are equal, yet partnering with Qin as emperor means the empire alone honors Qin and slight Qi; relinquishing the emperor title means the empire loves Qi and hates Qin. Attacking Zhao is not as advantageous as attacking the wicked Song. Therefore I wish Your Majesty to clearly relinquish the emperor title to gather the empire, double-cross the covenant to make Qin our guest, avoid contending for supremacy, and in the interval Your Majesty may take Song.

sentences.zh: 夫有宋，衛之陽地危；

translations.literal: Fu have Song, Wei zhi yang land wei;
translations.idiomatic: For if we have Song, Wei's southern lands are endangered;

sentences.zh: 有濟西，趙之阿東國危；

translations.literal: Have Ji xi, Zhao zhi e dong country wei;
translations.idiomatic: If we have the west of Ji, Zhao's eastern dependencies are endangered;

sentences.zh: 有淮北，楚之東國危；

translations.literal: Have Huai bei, Chu zhi dong country wei;
translations.idiomatic: If we have the north of Huai, Chu's eastern territories are endangered;

sentences.zh: 有陶、平陸，梁門不開。

translations.literal: Have Tao, Ping Lu, Liang men not open.
translations.idiomatic: If we have Tao and Pinglu, Liang's gates will not open.

sentences.zh: 釋帝而貸之以伐桀宋之事，國重而名尊，燕楚所以形服，天下莫敢不聽，此湯武之舉也。

translations.literal: Shi di yet dai it with attack Jie Song zhi shi, country zhong yet ming zun, Yan Chu so with xing fu, tian xia mo dare not listen, this Tang Wu zhi ju.
translations.idiomatic: Relinquish the emperor title and lend this pretext of attacking the wicked Song, the kingdom will be weighty and the name honored, Yan and Chu will submit in form, the empire will dare not disobey—this is the action of Tang and Wu.

sentences.zh: 敬秦以為名，而後使天下憎之，此所謂以卑為尊者也。

translations.literal: Jing Qin with become ming, yet after make tian xia zeng it, this place call with bei become zun ones.
translations.idiomatic: Respect Qin nominally, then afterward make the empire hate them—this is called using humility to achieve honor.

sentences.zh: 願王孰慮之。」

translations.literal: Wish wang shu lu it.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Majesty to carefully consider this.'

sentences.zh: 於是齊去帝復為王，秦亦去帝位。

translations.literal: Then Qi go di again become wang, Qin also go di wei.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qi relinquished the emperor title and became king again, Qin also relinquished the emperor position.

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, the king became Eastern Emperor, and King Zhao of Qin became Western Emperor. Su Dai came from Yan, entered Qi, and was seen at the east gate of Zhanghua Palace. The Qi king said: 'Ah, good, you have come! Qin has sent Wei Ran to confer the title of emperor; what do you think?' He replied: 'Your Majesty's question to me is abrupt, and the source of the trouble is subtle; I wish Your Majesty to accept it but not fully style yourself as such. If Qin styles itself as such and the empire accepts it, then Your Majesty may style yourself as such, with no harm. Moreover, yielding or contending for the emperor title does no harm. If Qin styles itself as such and the empire hates it, Your Majesty should therefore not style yourself as such, to gather the empire—this is great support. Moreover, if the empire establishes two emperors, does Your Majesty think the empire will honor Qi? Or honor Qin?' The king said: 'Honor Qin.' He said: 'If we relinquish the emperor title, will the empire love Qi? Or love Qin?' The king said: 'Love Qi and hate Qin.' He said: 'If the two emperors covenant to attack Zhao, which is more advantageous than attacking the wicked Song?' The king said: 'Attacking the wicked Song is advantageous.' He replied: 'The covenants are equal, yet partnering with Qin as emperor means the empire alone honors Qin and slight Qi; relinquishing the emperor title means the empire loves Qi and hates Qin. Attacking Zhao is not as advantageous as attacking the wicked Song. Therefore I wish Your Majesty to clearly relinquish the emperor title to gather the empire, double-cross the covenant to make Qin our guest, avoid contending for supremacy, and in the interval Your Majesty may take Song. For if we have Song, Wei's southern lands are endangered; If we have the west of Ji, Zhao's eastern dependencies are endangered; If we have the north of Huai, Chu's eastern territories are endangered; If we have Tao and Pinglu, Liang's gates will not open. Relinquish the emperor title and lend this pretext of attacking the wicked Song, the kingdom will be weighty and the name honored, Yan and Chu will submit in form, the empire will dare not disobey—this is the action of Tang and Wu. Respect Qin nominally, then afterward make the empire hate them—this is called using humility to achieve honor. I wish Your Majesty to carefully consider this.' Then Qi relinquished the emperor title and became king again, Qin also relinquished the emperor position.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，伐宋。

translations.literal: Thirty eight years, attack Song.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, they attacked Song.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王怒曰：「吾愛宋與愛新城、陽晉同。

translations.literal: Qin Zhao wang nu said: 'I love Song with love Xin cheng, Yang Jin same.'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Qin angrily said: 'I love Song the same as I love Xincheng and Yangjin.

sentences.zh: 韓聶與吾友也，而攻吾所愛，何也？」

translations.literal: Han Nie with I friend, yet attack I place love, what?'
translations.idiomatic: Han Nie is my friend, yet you attack what I love—why?'

sentences.zh: 蘇代為齊謂秦王曰：「韓聶之攻宋，所以為王也。

translations.literal: Su Dai for Qi wei Qin wang said: 'Han Nie zhi attack Song, so with become wang.
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai, on behalf of Qi, spoke to the Qin king: 'Han Nie's attack on Song is actually for Your Majesty's benefit.

sentences.zh: 齊彊，輔之以宋，楚魏必恐，恐必西事秦，是王不煩一兵，不傷一士，無事而割安邑也，此韓聶之所禱於王也。」

translations.literal: Qi qiang, fu it with Song, Chu Wei must kong, kong must xi shi Qin, is wang not fan one troops, not shang one shi, no shi yet cut An Yi, this Han Nie zhi place dao yu wang.'
translations.idiomatic: If Qi grows strong and is aided by Song, Chu and Wei will certainly fear, and in fear they will certainly serve Qin to the west. This means Your Majesty troubles not one soldier, harms not one warrior, and without effort carves out Anyi—this is what Han Nie prays for from Your Majesty.'

sentences.zh: 秦王曰：「吾患齊之難知。

translations.literal: Qin wang said: 'I huan Qi zhi nan zhi.'
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king said: 'I am troubled by Qi's unpredictability.

sentences.zh: 一從一衡，其說何也？」

translations.literal: One follow one heng, its shuo what?'
translations.idiomatic: Sometimes allied, sometimes opposed—what explanation is there?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「天下國令齊可知乎？

translations.literal: Answer said: 'Tian xia country ling Qi can zhi?
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'In the empire's commands, is Qi predictable?

sentences.zh: 齊以攻宋，其知事秦以萬乘之國自輔，不西事秦則宋治不安。

translations.literal: Qi with attack Song, its zhi shi Qin with wan sheng zhi country self fu, not xi shi Qin then Song treat not an.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacks Song knowing it serves Qin to aid itself with a ten-thousand chariot kingdom; if it does not serve Qin to the west, Song's governance will not be peaceful.

sentences.zh: 中國白頭游敖之士皆積智欲離齊秦之交，伏式結軼西馳者，未有一人言善齊者也，伏式結軼東馳者，未有一人言善秦者也。

translations.literal: Zhong guo bai tou you ao zhi shi all ji zhi desire li Qi Qin zhi jiao, fu shi jie yi xi chi ones, not have one person yan shan Qi ones, fu shi jie yi dong chi ones, not have one person yan shan Qin ones.
translations.idiomatic: The white-haired wandering persuaders of China all accumulate wisdom desiring to separate Qi and Qin's alliance; those hiding crossbows and tying letters galloping west have not one speaking well of Qi; those hiding crossbows and tying letters galloping east have not one speaking well of Qin.

sentences.zh: 何則？

translations.literal: What then?
translations.idiomatic: Why?

sentences.zh: 皆不欲齊秦之合也。

translations.literal: All not desire Qi Qin zhi he.
translations.idiomatic: All do not desire Qi and Qin's union.

sentences.zh: 何晉楚之智而齊秦之愚也！

translations.literal: What Jin Chu zhi zhi yet Qi Qin zhi yu!
translations.idiomatic: How wise are Jin and Chu, how foolish Qi and Qin!

sentences.zh: 晉楚合必議齊秦，齊秦合必圖晉楚，請以此決事。」

translations.literal: Jin Chu he must yi Qi Qin, Qi Qin he must tu Jin Chu, request with this jue shi.'
translations.idiomatic: When Jin and Chu unite they must plot against Qi and Qin; when Qi and Qin unite they must scheme against Jin and Chu. Please decide affairs with this.'

sentences.zh: 秦王曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Qin wang said: 'Nuo.'
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king said: 'Agreed.'

sentences.zh: 於是齊遂伐宋，宋王出亡，死於溫。

translations.literal: Then Qi sui attack Song, Song wang out perish, die yu Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qi proceeded to attack Song; the Song king fled and died at Wen.

sentences.zh: 齊南割楚之淮北，西侵三晉，欲以并周室，為天子。

translations.literal: Qi nan cut Chu zhi Huai bei, xi qin three Jin, desire with bing Zhou shi, become tian zi.
translations.idiomatic: Qi carved south from Chu the north of Huai, invaded west the three Jin, desiring to annex Zhou and become Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 泗上諸侯鄒魯之君皆稱臣，諸侯恐懼。

translations.literal: Si shang various hou Zou Lu zhi jun all name chen, various hou kong ju.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords of Zou and Lu above the Si all styled themselves ministers; the feudal lords were fearful.

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, they attacked Song. King Zhao of Qin angrily said: 'I love Song the same as I love Xincheng and Yangjin. Han Nie is my friend, yet you attack what I love—why?' Su Dai, on behalf of Qi, spoke to the Qin king: 'Han Nie's attack on Song is actually for Your Majesty's benefit. If Qi grows strong and is aided by Song, Chu and Wei will certainly fear, and in fear they will certainly serve Qin to the west. This means Your Majesty troubles not one soldier, harms not one warrior, and without effort carves out Anyi—this is what Han Nie prays for from Your Majesty.' The Qin king said: 'I am troubled by Qi's unpredictability. Sometimes allied, sometimes opposed—what explanation is there?' He replied: 'In the empire's commands, is Qi predictable? Qi attacks Song knowing it serves Qin to aid itself with a ten-thousand chariot kingdom; if it does not serve Qin to the west, Song's governance will not be peaceful. The white-haired wandering persuaders of China all accumulate wisdom desiring to separate Qi and Qin's alliance; those hiding crossbows and tying letters galloping west have not one speaking well of Qi; those hiding crossbows and tying letters galloping east have not one speaking well of Qin. Why? All do not desire Qi and Qin's union. How wise are Jin and Chu, how foolish Qi and Qin! When Jin and Chu unite they must plot against Qi and Qin; when Qi and Qin unite they must scheme against Jin and Chu. Please decide affairs with this.' The Qin king said: 'Agreed.' Then Qi proceeded to attack Song; the Song king fled and died at Wen. Qi carved south from Chu the north of Huai, invaded west the three Jin, desiring to annex Zhou and become Son of Heaven. The feudal lords of Zou and Lu above the Si all styled themselves ministers; the feudal lords were fearful.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，秦來伐，拔我列城九。

translations.literal: Thirty nine years, Qin come attack, ba I lie cheng nine.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, Qin came to attack and captured nine of our cities in succession.

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Qin came to attack and captured nine of our cities in succession.

sentences.zh: 四十年，燕、秦、楚、三晉合謀，各出銳師以伐，敗我濟西。

translations.literal: Forty years, Yan, Qin, Chu, three Jin he mou, each out rui shi with attack, defeat I Ji xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fortieth year, Yan, Qin, Chu, and the three Jin conspired, each sending elite troops to attack, defeating us at Jixi.

sentences.zh: 王解而卻。

translations.literal: Wang jie yet que.
translations.idiomatic: The king untied his hair and retreated.

sentences.zh: 燕將樂毅遂入臨淄，盡取齊之寶藏器。

translations.literal: Yan jiang Yue Yi sui enter Lin Zi, all take Qi zhi bao zang qi.
translations.idiomatic: Yan general Yue Yi then entered Linzi and took all Qi's treasure stores and vessels.

sentences.zh: 湣王出亡，之衛。

translations.literal: Min wang out perish, zhi Wei.
translations.idiomatic: King Min fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 衛君辟宮捨之，稱臣而共具。

translations.literal: Wei jun bi gong sha it, name chen yet together ju.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei lord cleared a palace to house him, styled himself minister and provided supplies together.

sentences.zh: 湣王不遜，衛人侵之。

translations.literal: Min wang not xun, Wei person qin it.
translations.idiomatic: King Min was not deferential, and Wei people invaded him.

sentences.zh: 湣王去，走鄒、魯，有驕色，鄒、魯君弗內，遂走莒。

translations.literal: Min wang go, zou Zou, Lu, have jiao color, Zou, Lu jun not nei, sui zou Ju.
translations.idiomatic: King Min departed, fleeing to Zou and Lu, showing arrogant bearing; the Zou and Lu lords would not admit him, so he fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 楚使淖齒將兵救齊，因相齊湣王。

translations.literal: Chu make Nao Chi jiang troops save Qi, because xiang Qi Min wang.
translations.idiomatic: Chu sent Nao Chi to lead troops to save Qi, and he became chancellor to Qi's King Min.

sentences.zh: 淖齒遂殺湣王而與燕共分齊之侵地鹵器。

translations.literal: Nao Chi sui kill Min wang yet with Yan together divide Qi zhi qin land lu qi.
translations.idiomatic: Nao Chi then killed King Min and together with Yan divided Qi's invaded lands and booty.

translations.literal: In the fortieth year, Yan, Qin, Chu, and the three Jin conspired, each sending elite troops to attack, defeating us at Jixi. The king untied his hair and retreated. Yan general Yue Yi then entered Linzi and took all Qi's treasure stores and vessels. King Min fled to Wei. The Wei lord cleared a palace to house him, styled himself minister and provided supplies together. King Min was not deferential, and Wei people invaded him. King Min departed, fleeing to Zou and Lu, showing arrogant bearing; the Zou and Lu lords would not admit him, so he fled to Ju. Chu sent Nao Chi to lead troops to save Qi, and he became chancellor to Qi's King Min. Nao Chi then killed King Min and together with Yan divided Qi's invaded lands and booty.

sentences.zh: 湣王之遇殺，其子法章變名姓為莒太史敫家庸。

translations.literal: Min wang zhi yu kill, its zi Fa Zhang change ming xing become Ju tai shi Jiao home yong.
translations.idiomatic: When King Min met his death, his son Fa Zhang changed his name and surname to become a hired laborer in the household of Ju's Grand Historian Jiao.

sentences.zh: 太史敫女奇法章狀貌，以為非恒人，憐而常竊衣食之，而與私通焉。

translations.literal: Tai shi Jiao female qi Fa Zhang zhuang mao, with wei not heng person, lian yet constant qie yi shi it, yet with private tong yan.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian Jiao's daughter was amazed by Fa Zhang's appearance and bearing, considering him no ordinary person, pitied him and constantly stole clothes and food for him, and had illicit relations with him.

sentences.zh: 淖齒既以去莒，莒中人及齊亡臣相聚求湣王子，欲立之。

translations.literal: Nao Chi ji with go Ju, Ju zhong person and Qi wang chen each gather seek Min wang zi, desire stand it.
translations.idiomatic: After Nao Chi departed Ju, the people of Ju and Qi's exiled ministers gathered together seeking King Min's son, desiring to establish him.

sentences.zh: 法章懼其誅己也，久之，乃敢自言「我湣王子也」。

translations.literal: Fa Zhang ju its zhu self, long it, then dare self yan 'I Min wang zi.'
translations.idiomatic: Fa Zhang feared they would execute him, and after a long time dared to speak himself: 'I am King Min's son.'

sentences.zh: 於是莒人共立法章，是為襄王。

translations.literal: Then Ju person together establish Fa Zhang, is become Xiang wang.
translations.idiomatic: Then the Ju people together established Fa Zhang, who became King Xiang.

sentences.zh: 以保莒城而布告齊國中：「王已立在莒矣。」

translations.literal: With bao Ju cheng yet bu gao Qi country zhong: 'Wang already stand in Ju.'
translations.idiomatic: To defend Ju city they proclaimed throughout Qi: 'The king has already been established in Ju.'

translations.literal: When King Min met his death, his son Fa Zhang changed his name and surname to become a hired laborer in the household of Ju's Grand Historian Jiao. Grand Historian Jiao's daughter was amazed by Fa Zhang's appearance and bearing, considering him no ordinary person, pitied him and constantly stole clothes and food for him, and had illicit relations with him. After Nao Chi departed Ju, the people of Ju and Qi's exiled ministers gathered together seeking King Min's son, desiring to establish him. Fa Zhang feared they would execute him, and after a long time dared to speak himself: 'I am King Min's son.' Then the Ju people together established Fa Zhang, who became King Xiang. To defend Ju city they proclaimed throughout Qi: 'The king has already been established in Ju.'

sentences.zh: 襄王既立，立太史氏女為王后，是為君王后，生子建。

translations.literal: Xiang wang ji stand, stand Tai shi shi female become wang hou, is become Jun wang hou, sheng zi Jian.
translations.idiomatic: Once King Xiang was established, he made the Grand Historian's daughter queen, who became Queen Jun, and she bore a son Jian.

sentences.zh: 太史敫曰：「女不取媒因自嫁，非吾種也，汙吾世。」

translations.literal: Tai shi Jiao said: 'Female not take mei because self jia, not I zhong, wu I shi.'
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian Jiao said: 'The girl took no matchmaker but married herself; she is not of my seed and defiles my lineage.'

sentences.zh: 終身不睹君王后。

translations.literal: Zhong shen not du Jun wang hou.
translations.idiomatic: His whole life he did not see Queen Jun.

sentences.zh: 君王后賢，不以不睹故失人子之禮。

translations.literal: Jun wang hou xian, not with not du reason lose person zi zhi li.
translations.idiomatic: Queen Jun was worthy and did not lose the rites of a filial child because of not being seen.

translations.literal: Once King Xiang was established, he made the Grand Historian's daughter queen, who became Queen Jun, and she bore a son Jian. Grand Historian Jiao said: 'The girl took no matchmaker but married herself; she is not of my seed and defiles my lineage.' His whole life he did not see Queen Jun. Queen Jun was worthy and did not lose the rites of a filial child because of not being seen.

sentences.zh: 襄王在莒五年，田單以即墨攻破燕軍，迎襄王於莒，入臨菑。

translations.literal: Xiang wang in Ju five years, Tian Dan with Ji Mo attack break Yan army, welcome Xiang wang yu Ju, enter Lin Zi.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang was in Ju for five years when Tian Dan attacked and broke the Yan army from Jimo, welcomed King Xiang from Ju, and entered Linzi.

sentences.zh: 齊故地盡復屬齊。

translations.literal: Qi old land all again shu Qi.
translations.idiomatic: All Qi's old lands again belonged to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊封田單為安平君。

translations.literal: Qi seal Tian Dan become An Ping jun.
translations.idiomatic: Qi enfeoffed Tian Dan as Lord of Anping.

translations.literal: King Xiang was in Ju for five years when Tian Dan attacked and broke the Yan army from Jimo, welcomed King Xiang from Ju, and entered Linzi. All Qi's old lands again belonged to Qi. Qi enfeoffed Tian Dan as Lord of Anping.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦擊我剛壽。

translations.literal: Fourteen years, Qin strike I Gang Shou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Qin attacked our Gangshou.

sentences.zh: 十九年，襄王卒，子建立。

translations.literal: Nineteen years, Xiang wang die, zi Jian stand.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, King Xiang died, and his son Jian ascended.

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Qin attacked our Gangshou. In the nineteenth year, King Xiang died, and his son Jian ascended.

sentences.zh: 王建立六年，秦攻趙，齊楚救之。

translations.literal: Wang Jian stand six years, Qin attack Zhao, Qi Chu save it.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year of King Jian's establishment, Qin attacked Zhao, and Qi and Chu saved them.

sentences.zh: 秦計曰：「齊楚救趙，親則退兵，不親遂攻之。」

translations.literal: Qin plan said: 'Qi Chu save Zhao, qin then retreat troops, not qin sui attack it.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin planned: 'If Qi and Chu save Zhao with close alliance, then withdraw troops; if not close, then attack them.'

sentences.zh: 趙無食，請粟於齊，齊不聽。

translations.literal: Zhao no shi, request su yu Qi, Qi not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao had no food and requested grain from Qi, but Qi would not listen.

sentences.zh: 周子曰：「不如聽之以退秦兵，不聽則秦兵不卻，是秦之計中而齊楚之計過也。

translations.literal: Zhou zi said: 'Not if listen it with retreat Qin troops, not listen then Qin troops not que, is Qin zhi plan zhong yet Qi Chu zhi plan guo.
translations.idiomatic: Master Zhou said: 'It would be better to listen and use it to withdraw Qin troops; if not listen then Qin troops will not withdraw—this fulfills Qin's plan but misses Qi and Chu's strategy.

sentences.zh: 且趙之於齊楚，捍蔽也，猶齒之有脣也，脣亡則齒寒。

translations.literal: And Zhao zhi yu Qi Chu, han bi, you chi zhi have chun, chun perish then chi han.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Zhao is a bulwark for Qi and Chu, like teeth having lips; if lips perish then teeth are cold.

sentences.zh: 今日亡趙，明日患及齊楚。

translations.literal: Today perish Zhao, tomorrow huan reach Qi Chu.
translations.idiomatic: If today Zhao perishes, tomorrow calamity reaches Qi and Chu.

sentences.zh: 且救趙之務，宜若奉漏甕沃焦釜也。

translations.literal: And save Zhao zhi wu, yi if feng lou weng wo jiao fu.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the task of saving Zhao should be like carrying a leaking urn to water a scorched cauldron.

sentences.zh: 夫救趙，高義也；

translations.literal: Fu save Zhao, gao yi;
translations.idiomatic: For saving Zhao is lofty righteousness;

sentences.zh: 卻秦兵，顯名也。

translations.literal: Que Qin troops, xian ming.
translations.idiomatic: Driving back Qin troops brings illustrious name.

sentences.zh: 義救亡國，威卻彊秦之兵，不務為此而務愛粟，為國計者過矣。」

translations.literal: Yi save perish country, wei que qiang Qin zhi troops, not wu become this yet wu love su, become country plan ones guo.'
translations.idiomatic: Righteously saving a perishing kingdom, awesomely driving back strong Qin's troops—not pursuing this but loving grain, the national strategists have erred.'

sentences.zh: 齊王弗聽。

translations.literal: Qi wang not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king would not listen.

sentences.zh: 秦破趙於長平四十餘萬，遂圍邯鄲。

translations.literal: Qin break Zhao yu Chang Ping forty yu wan, sui surround Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: Qin broke Zhao at Changping with over four hundred thousand, then besieged Handan.

translations.literal: In the sixth year of King Jian's establishment, Qin attacked Zhao, and Qi and Chu saved them. Qin planned: 'If Qi and Chu save Zhao with close alliance, then withdraw troops; if not close, then attack them.' Zhao had no food and requested grain from Qi, but Qi would not listen. Master Zhou said: 'It would be better to listen and use it to withdraw Qin troops; if not listen then Qin troops will not withdraw—this fulfills Qin's plan but misses Qi and Chu's strategy. Moreover, Zhao is a bulwark for Qi and Chu, like teeth having lips; if lips perish then teeth are cold. If today Zhao perishes, tomorrow calamity reaches Qi and Chu. Moreover, the task of saving Zhao should be like carrying a leaking urn to water a scorched cauldron. For saving Zhao is lofty righteousness; Driving back Qin troops brings illustrious name. Righteously saving a perishing kingdom, awesomely driving back strong Qin's troops—not pursuing this but loving grain, the national strategists have erred.' The Qi king would not listen. Qin broke Zhao at Changping with over four hundred thousand, then besieged Handan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦滅周。

translations.literal: Sixteen years, Qin extinguish Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qin extinguished Zhou.

sentences.zh: 君王后卒。

translations.literal: Jun wang hou die.
translations.idiomatic: Queen Jun died.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，秦置東郡。

translations.literal: Twenty three years, Qin zhi Dong jun.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Qin established Dong commandery.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，王入朝秦，秦王政置酒咸陽。

translations.literal: Twenty eight years, wang enter court Qin, Qin wang Zheng zhi jiu Xian Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the king entered to court Qin, and Qin King Zheng hosted a banquet at Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，秦滅韓。

translations.literal: Thirty five years, Qin extinguish Han.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Qin extinguished Han.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦滅趙。

translations.literal: Thirty seven years, Qin extinguish Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Qin extinguished Zhao.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，燕使荊軻刺秦王，秦王覺，殺軻。

translations.literal: Thirty eight years, Yan make Jing Ke ci Qin wang, Qin wang jue, kill Ke.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, Yan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin king; the Qin king became aware and killed Ke.

sentences.zh: 明年，秦破燕，燕王亡走遼東。

translations.literal: Next year, Qin break Yan, Yan wang perish zou Liao Dong.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Qin broke Yan, and the Yan king fled to Liaodong.

sentences.zh: 明年，秦滅魏，秦兵次於歷下。

translations.literal: Next year, Qin extinguish Wei, Qin troops ci yu Li Xia.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Qin extinguished Wei, and Qin troops halted at Lixia.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，秦滅楚。

translations.literal: Forty two years, Qin extinguish Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Qin extinguished Chu.

sentences.zh: 明年，虜代王嘉，滅燕王喜。

translations.literal: Next year, lu Dai wang Jia, extinguish Yan wang Xi.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, they captured King Jia of Dai and extinguished King Xi of Yan.

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qin extinguished Zhou. Queen Jun died. In the twenty-third year, Qin established Dong commandery. In the twenty-eighth year, the king entered to court Qin, and Qin King Zheng hosted a banquet at Xianyang. In the thirty-fifth year, Qin extinguished Han. In the thirty-seventh year, Qin extinguished Zhao. In the thirty-eighth year, Yan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin king; the Qin king became aware and killed Ke. The next year, Qin broke Yan, and the Yan king fled to Liaodong. The next year, Qin extinguished Wei, and Qin troops halted at Lixia. In the forty-second year, Qin extinguished Chu. The next year, they captured King Jia of Dai and extinguished King Xi of Yan.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，秦兵擊齊。

translations.literal: Forty four years, Qin troops strike Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, Qin troops attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王聽相后勝計，不戰，以兵降秦。

translations.literal: Qi wang listen xiang Hou Sheng plan, not battle, with troops descend Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king listened to Chancellor Hou Sheng's plan, did not fight, and surrendered troops to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦虜王建，遷之共。

translations.literal: Qin lu wang Jian, move it Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured King Jian and moved him to Gong.

sentences.zh: 遂滅齊為郡。

translations.literal: Sui extinguish Qi become jun.
translations.idiomatic: Thus extinguished Qi and made it a commandery.

sentences.zh: 天下壹并於秦，秦王政立號為皇帝。

translations.literal: Tian xia yi bing yu Qin, Qin wang Zheng stand hao become huang di.
translations.idiomatic: The empire was unified under Qin, and Qin King Zheng established the title of emperor.

sentences.zh: 始，君王后賢，事秦謹，與諸侯信，齊亦東邊海上，秦日夜攻三晉、燕、楚，五國各自救於秦，以故王建立四十餘年不受兵。

translations.literal: Shi, Jun wang hou xian, shi Qin jin, with various hou xin, Qi also dong bian hai shang, Qin ri ye attack three Jin, Yan, Chu, five country each self save yu Qin, with reason wang Jian stand forty yu year not receive troops.
translations.idiomatic: At first, Queen Jun was worthy, served Qin cautiously, was trustworthy with the feudal lords, and Qi was also bordered by the eastern sea; Qin attacked the three Jin, Yan, and Chu day and night, and the five kingdoms each defended themselves against Qin, which is why King Jian established himself for over forty years without suffering invasion.

sentences.zh: 君王后死，后勝相齊，多受秦閒金，多使賓客入秦，秦又多予金，客皆為反閒，勸王去從朝秦，不修攻戰之備，不助五國攻秦，秦以故得滅五國。

translations.literal: Jun wang hou die, Hou Sheng xiang Qi, duo receive Qin jian jin, duo make bin ke enter Qin, Qin again duo yu jin, ke all become fan jian, quan wang go follow court Qin, not repair attack battle zhi bei, not help five country attack Qin, Qin with reason obtain extinguish five country.
translations.idiomatic: After Queen Jun died, Hou Sheng became Qi chancellor, received much Qin gold for espionage, sent many guests into Qin, and Qin gave much gold; the guests all became double agents, advising the king to abandon alliances and court Qin, not prepare for attack and battle, not help the five kingdoms attack Qin, which is why Qin was able to extinguish the five kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 五國已亡，秦兵卒入臨淄，民莫敢格者。

translations.literal: Five country already perish, Qin troops zu enter Lin Zi, people mo dare ge ones.
translations.idiomatic: Once the five kingdoms had perished, Qin troops suddenly entered Linzi, and no people dared resist.

sentences.zh: 王建遂降，遷於共。

translations.literal: Wang Jian sui descend, move yu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: King Jian then surrendered and was moved to Gong.

sentences.zh: 故齊人怨王建不蚤與諸侯合從攻秦，聽姦臣賓客以亡其國，歌之曰：「松耶柏耶？

translations.literal: Therefore Qi person yuan wang Jian not early with various hou he cong attack Qin, listen jian minister bin ke with perish its country, song it said: 'Song, bai?
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Qi people resented King Jian for not early uniting with the feudal lords to attack Qin, listening to treacherous ministers and guests to lose his kingdom, and sang of it: 'Pine or cypress?

sentences.zh: 住建共者客耶？」

translations.literal: Zhu Jian Gong ones ke?'
translations.idiomatic: The one dwelling with Jian in Gong is a guest?'

sentences.zh: 疾建用客之不詳也。

translations.literal: Ji Jian use ke zhi not xiang.
translations.idiomatic: Hating that Jian's use of guests was inauspicious.

translations.literal: In the forty-fourth year, Qin troops attacked Qi. The Qi king listened to Chancellor Hou Sheng's plan, did not fight, and surrendered troops to Qin. Qin captured King Jian and moved him to Gong. Thus extinguished Qi and made it a commandery. The empire was unified under Qin, and Qin King Zheng established the title of emperor. At first, Queen Jun was worthy, served Qin cautiously, was trustworthy with the feudal lords, and Qi was also bordered by the eastern sea; Qin attacked the three Jin, Yan, and Chu day and night, and the five kingdoms each defended themselves against Qin, which is why King Jian established himself for over forty years without suffering invasion. After Queen Jun died, Hou Sheng became Qi chancellor, received much Qin gold for espionage, sent many guests into Qin, and Qin gave much gold; the guests all became double agents, advising the king to abandon alliances and court Qin, not prepare for attack and battle, not help the five kingdoms attack Qin, which is why Qin was able to extinguish the five kingdoms. Once the five kingdoms had perished, Qin troops suddenly entered Linzi, and no people dared resist. King Jian then surrendered and was moved to Gong. Therefore Qi people resented King Jian for not early uniting with the feudal lords to attack Qin, listening to treacherous ministers and guests to lose his kingdom, and sang of it: 'Pine or cypress? The one dwelling with Jian in Gong is a guest?' Hating that Jian's use of guests was inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：蓋孔子晚而喜易。

translations.literal: Tai shi gong said: Cover Kong zi late yet hi Yi.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Indeed, Confucius in his later years delighted in the Changes.

sentences.zh: 易之為術，幽明遠矣，非通人達才孰能注意焉！

translations.literal: Yi zhi become shu, you ming yuan, not tong person da cai shu able zhu yi yan!
translations.idiomatic: The Changes as a discipline is profound and far-reaching; who but the perspicacious and accomplished can attend to it!

sentences.zh: 笔周太史之卦田敬仲完，占至十世之後；

translations.literal: Bi Zhou tai shi zhi gua Tian Jing Zhong Wan, zhan reach ten shi after;
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou's Grand Historian divined for Tian Jingzhong Wan, he prognosticated to ten generations later;

sentences.zh: 及完奔齊，懿仲卜之亦云。

translations.literal: Reach Wan ben Qi, Yi Zhong bu it also cloud.
translations.idiomatic: And when Wan fled to Qi, Yi Zhong divined it and it was the same.

sentences.zh: 田乞及常所以比犯二君，專齊國之政，非必事勢之漸然也，蓋若遵厭兆祥云。

translations.literal: Tian Qi and Chang so with bi fan two jun, zhuan Qi country zhi zheng, not must shi shi zhi jian ran, cover if zun yan zhao xiang cloud.
translations.idiomatic: That Tian Qi and Chang were able to repeatedly offend two rulers and monopolize Qi's governance was not necessarily a gradual development of circumstances, but rather as if following the omens and portents.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Indeed, Confucius in his later years delighted in the Changes. The Changes as a discipline is profound and far-reaching; who but the perspicacious and accomplished can attend to it! When Zhou's Grand Historian divined for Tian Jingzhong Wan, he prognosticated to ten generations later; And when Wan fled to Qi, Yi Zhong divined it and it was the same. That Tian Qi and Chang were able to repeatedly offend two rulers and monopolize Qi's governance was not necessarily a gradual development of circumstances, but rather as if following the omens and portents.
